title: Integrated Marketing Manager, Fitbit
responsibilities:
• Develop strategy for integrated marketing campaigns that extend our brand narrative and support our business goals throughout the year; campaigns to range from small-scale thematic moments executed on owned channels to larger brand activations that extend our TV platform.
  • Drive execution of integrated marketing programs, aligning teams across owned and/or paid channels for amplification (e.g., creative, social, influencer, media, blog, and web/lifecycle marketing).
  • Manage campaign analysis, reporting on program impact, and retrospective learnings.
  • Work with cross-functional partners to ensure alignment of marketing efforts across all external-facing communication channels, ensuring a clear consistent message to our audience across all touchpoints.
  • Maintain integrated marketing calendar for sales and marketing teams and executives to visualize all marketing efforts across all channels at any given time.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
  • 6 years of experience in a general marketing or integrated marketing role
  • Experience managing multiple marketing projects simultaneously
  • Experience with Program Management

Preferred qualifications:

  • 6 years of experience in integrated marketing or cross-functional marketing
  • Ability to perform in a team environment and manage multiple deadline-driven projects
  • Leadership skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues and vendors at all levels to meet business goals
  • Excellent organizational, planning and project management skills, with exceptional time management skills and the ability to multitask
  • Ability to work effectively in ambiguity with a bias for action

description:
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the representation of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

The Fitbit Brand and Integrated Marketing team is looking for an Integrated Marketing Manager to help drive the strategy and execution of integrated marketing campaigns throughout the year. Campaigns may range in size and budget.

In this role, you will also serve as a "dot-connector" across the sales and marketing organization, ensuring that all touchpoints are communicating the same clear and consistent brand messaging through all channels and efforts.

Fitbit’s wide range of innovative products, including smartwatches, trackers, and a smart scale, help people lead healthier, more active lives by empowering them with data, inspiration, and guidance to reach their health and fitness goals. Coupled with our leading software and Fitbit Premium, our immersive platform experience delivers personalized experiences, insights, and guidance to support our users’ health and wellness. Fitbit’s mission has always been to help make everyone in the world healthier and now, as part of Google we’ll be able to make health even more accessible to everyone.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $146,000 - $157,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.
application_instruction: This role may also be located in our Playa Vista, CA campus.

title: Sales Lead, Fitbit
responsibilities:
• Help ensure commercial success.
  • Partner with the Carrier Sales team to develop partner strategies and business plans.
  • Support Carrier Sales team in partner facing product arranging presentations to achieve business in goals.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional partners in Strategy Operations, Product Marketing, and Product Management to help develop the Go-To-Market plan.
  • Serve as a Go-To-Market leader and advocate within Google, distill insights, and pursue improvements based on analysis of key performance metrics.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in sales management, business development, or partner management in retail, FMCG, Carrier, or Consumer Electronics companies.
  • Experience in management of partner relationship.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in go-to-market functions such as pricing/commercial, campaign management, Customer Relationship Management (CRM)/CLM, partner management, consumer operations, and retail/channel partner management.
  • Experience in business development in a fast-growth, technology environment.
  • Ability to persuade and communicate goals.
  • Ability to motivate at every level, and think strategically to align strategy and tactics with an overall brand goals.
  • Ability to work with differing priorities, multiple projects, and virtual teams and partners.
  • Excellent leadership and collaboration skills.

description:
Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

Fitbit's mission is to help everyone become healthier.

At Fitbit, our role is to help people understand how key pillars of health and wellness (activity, sleep, stress, and nutrition) all fit together to empower people to take control of their health.

You will be responsible for Fitbit Devices and Services across Consumer Electronics, Mass, Carrier, Online and Specialty retailers in North America.

Fitbit’s wide range of innovative products, including smartwatches, trackers, and a smart scale, help people lead healthier, more active lives by empowering them with data, inspiration, and guidance to reach their health and fitness goals. Coupled with our leading software and Fitbit Premium, our immersive platform experience delivers personalized experiences, insights, and guidance to support our users’ health and wellness. Fitbit’s mission has always been to help make everyone in the world healthier and now, as part of Google we’ll be able to make health even more accessible to everyone.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $109,000 - $117,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Fitbit
responsibilities:
• Write and test product or system development code.
  • Participate in, or lead design reviews with peers and stakeholders to decide amongst available technologies.
  • Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).
  • Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback.
  • Triage product or system issues and debug/track/resolve by analyzing the sources of issues and the impact on hardware, network, or service operations and quality.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, and with data structures/algorithms.
  • 3 years of experience testing, maintaining, or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.
  • 1 year of experience in a technical leadership role.
  • Experience developing accessible technologies.

description:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.

Fitbit’s wide range of innovative products, including smartwatches, trackers, and a smart scale, help people lead healthier, more active lives by empowering them with data, inspiration, and guidance to reach their health and fitness goals. Coupled with our leading software and Fitbit Premium, our immersive platform experience delivers personalized experiences, insights, and guidance to support our users’ health and wellness. Fitbit’s mission has always been to help make everyone in the world healthier and now, as part of Google we’ll be able to make health even more accessible to everyone.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $120,000 - $129,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

  • 5 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, and with data structures/algorithms.
  • 3 years of experience testing, maintaining, or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture.

title: Software Engineer III, Android, Fitbit
responsibilities:
• Design and build features on a user-facing Android app that is serving many of users.
  • Collaborate with backend engineers and iOS engineers in delivering a feature.
  • Participate in design and development of both customer and backend sides of the product.
  • Teach and influence other team member as the expert in the Android domain.
  • Collaborate with clinical team, UX designers and researchers, PMs to improve and refine the team's products.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree.
  • 2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms in either an academic or industry setting.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.
  • 2 years of experience with iOS or Android application development.
  • 2 years of experience with performance, large scale systems data analysis, visualization tools, and/or debugging.
  • Experience developing accessible technologies.
  • Experience building healthcare systems.

description:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

Our team aims to enable a thoughtful privacy centric approach of sharing fitness, wellness, health, and clinical data with friends, family, and caregivers. You'll join a diverse team with strong values and who are passionate about improving healthcare.In this role, you’ll collaborate closely with our clinical team and Googlers with healthcare experience. You will have the opportunity to own a part of a complex, multi-year project that will be consumer-facing as well as partner-facing. Your work will help drive organization, coordination, and access of personal health records as well as impact on health literacy and fairness for patients.

Fitbit’s diverse line of innovative products of smartwatches, trackers and smart scale help people lead healthier, more active lives by empowering them with data, inspiration and guidance to reach their health and fitness goals. Our products deliver personalized experiences, insights and guidance through leading software and interactive tools to support our users’ health and wellness. Partnering with Google will expand our resources and global platform, and we will be able to accelerate innovation in the wearables category to scale faster, and make health even more accessible to everyone.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $120,000 - $129,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Strategic Partner Manager, Health Plans and Solutions, Fitbit
responsibilities:
• Serve as the business owner and territory management lead within the health plan market. Generate pipeline growth and meet/exceed quarterly business goals.
  • Identify and develop business case analyses in response to a health plan’s underlying business needs and requirements. Conduct strategic planning discussions, document business and technical requirements, and align internal product, marketing, and clinical resources.
  • Obtain health plan partners, build a qualified pipeline, and strategically manage opportunities through agreement closure.
  • Work in collaboration with marketing on demand generation, event planning, and communication strategies.
  • Develop a deep understanding of our partner’s business model, organizational structure, go-to-market strategies, key customers, and platform/solution capabilities to influence how we deliver results.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of sales experience within the health plan market.
  • Experience in sales, discussing agreements, and delivering care management/wellbeing solutions.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in sales and business development in a fast-growth, technology environment.
  • Experience hosting virtual meetings to support the growth of a business.
  • Familiarity with Salesforce and knowledge of the Medicare market segment.
  • Ability to persuade, communicate vision, be an attentive listener, motivate at every level, and think strategically to align strategy and tactics with an overall brand vision.
  • Ability to work with differing priorities, multiple projects, and virtual teams and partners, with excellent leadership and collaboration skills.
  • Ability to travel up to 30% of the time.

description:
Fitbit Health Solutions (FHS) delivers leading wearable devices, software, and services to business-to-business (B2B) enterprise customers to drive healthy behavior change. Our solutions motivate and engage people in a personalized health experience across the full spectrum of care, from wellness and prevention to chronic condition management.

As a Strategic Partner Manager, you will engage with internal stakeholders and our valued health plan partners to drive growth of the business. You will be motivated to work with minimal guidance, detail-oriented, and accustomed to delivering complex solutions to health plan entities via a cross-functional team approach. You'll work in a fast-paced environment and be effective in managing multiple work streams. You'll strive for excellence in your daily work by maintaining a customer-centric focus and a team-oriented approach.

Fitbit’s diverse line of innovative products of smartwatches, trackers and smart scale help people lead healthier, more active lives by empowering them with data, inspiration and guidance to reach their health and fitness goals. Our products deliver personalized experiences, insights and guidance through leading software and interactive tools to support our users’ health and wellness. Partnering with Google will expand our resources and global platform, and we will be able to accelerate innovation in the wearables category to scale faster, and make health even more accessible to everyone.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) $131,200 + bonus + equity + benefits
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
The Cloud Data and Insights team is on a mission to develop a single unified view of Google Cloud’s data and speed up the cycle of insight. Providing more personalized user experiences and improving Google Cloud’s organizational velocity.

As an Analytics Engineer, you will work with your counterparts across the Sales, Marketing, Finance, and Customer Success teams to empower Google Cloud’s business users with data. In this role, you will structure questions into data focused analysis and work with LookML, SQL, Python, etc. to answer those questions. You will model reusable data structures with LookML, deliver data products, structure results with exploration tools, use dashboards, and presentations.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

description:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.

As an Application Engineer Manager, you will code to make a difference in the lives of Googlers. The Tools Development team in Corporate Engineering (CorpEng) for People Operations (PeopleOps) builds and maintains the applications that interact with Googlers from the moment after their offer acceptance throughout their career. We build services to support our extended workforce and ensure that our growing workforce can scale.In this role, you will help to power teams across Google to build applications and features that interact with Workday. You will lead developer teams within the Workday infrastructure to build APIs for Workday and integrations with Google systems. You will also engage the design from automating data migration to building the operational pipelines, unit and integration test framework. You will join a team comprised of engineers with domain expertise and others bringing fresh ideas and perspectives. You will play a key role in building the next generation of features critical to our mission.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $130,000 - $139,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado..
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Application Engineer, Devices and Services
responsibilities:
• Drive the design and architecture of new applications that improve how IT systems operate.
  • Provide technical leadership and guidance to team members to solve problems and oversee usage of best practices and technologies.
  • Partner with business and analyst teams to define and implement solutions that improve internal business processes.
  • Build solutions with custom frontends and backend services that automate business processes.
  • Integrate third party products into internal systems as well as support and upgrade implemented systems.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
  • Programming experience with Java, Web Services (e.g., RESTful, SOAP), JavaScript, and Android.
  • Experience with developing internal business applications and business integration.
  • Experience working with various Internet technologies such as Borg, CloudSQL, and Spanner.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
  • Experience implementing, customizing, and integrating third-party applications in the supply chain or business space.
  • Extensive experience in multiple full system implementation life cycles (e.g., analyze, design, build, test, implement, support).
  • Experience with enterprise application suites.
  • Effective interpersonal, analytical and communication skills.

description:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.

As an Application Engineer, you will be responsible for leading our efforts to build and integrate our supply chain systems and platforms. You will develop expertise in Google technologies and frameworks as well as third party tools, and leverage these to develop next generation solutions for the Devices and Services organization. Your role will encompass developing solutions, including design, architecture, and implementation.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $109,000 - $117,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

description:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.

With your technical expertise, you build business applications and influence the design of features that improve the reliability of our applications and systems. You also define the scope of technical projects and oversee execution.

In this role, you'll develop within the Workday infrastructure to build integrations with SAP, engage the design from automating data migration, to build the operational pipelines, and unit and integration test framework. You will join a team of engineers with domain experience, bringing ideas and perspectives.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $130,000 - $139,000 + bonus + equity + benefits..
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Applications Business Planner, Google Cloud Business Planning, Commercialization
responsibilities:

  • Validate commercial business case for product initiatives and execute the commercialization of product pricing models.
  • Define innovative packaging and pricing architectures that align to different customer segments and use cases.
  • Develop value-based pricing to capture the full business value delivered by Google Cloud Workspace and Looker.
  • Provide thought leadership among executive leaders and stakeholders to ensure appropriate business generation of our differentiated offerings, including the creation of channel programs, promotions, and discounting policies to drive product adoption.
qualifications:

description:
The Business Planning and Commercialization (BPC) team owns Strategic Packaging and Pricing for all of Google Cloud, including, Google Workspace, Google Cloud Platform, Maps, Looker, and AI/ML and solutions.

As part of BPC, our team focuses on applications. We partner with relevant Product and Partnership teams to enable commercialization of their respective portfolios. We develop use-case specific, value-based business generation models that resonate with both business and technology decision makers of small and medium-sized businesses (SMB) and enterprise customers and partners. Our scope is inclusive of enabling early adopters, packaging/pricing with business relevant meters, cross-product solutions, promotions and discounting models, channel economics, profit and loss planning and optimization, and other strategic initiatives.

In this role, you will drive innovation through all Google Cloud’s business generation policies, product and portfolio strategies, and commercial programs and structures. You will design and oversee the packaging, pricing architecture, and value pricing for Google Cloud Applications. You will design policies and structures with product managers, Sales teams, and Go-To-Market (GTM) leads, while influencing executive stakeholders to ensure successful rollouts of various products and programs. Other key responsibilities include, guiding the GTM team on commercialization across all channels (e.g., direct and partners) and making sure the business generation lands as intended.

You will drive critical initiatives that will transform business generation applications through strategic design, commercialization, and implementation, while balancing speed of execution with implementation constraints based on the right phased approach.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $147,000 - $158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

description:
As Corporate Counsel at Google, you work on the most exciting legal issues as disruptive technological innovations require creative and proactive legal guidance. You're part of a whip-smart group of in-house lawyers and the projects and cases you take on challenge you to think big and differently. You are collaborative -- ready to partner in initiatives that influence all aspects of the business and work with Googlers from all over the company. As an integrated part of the team, you proactively assess legal risks and advise on products that will not only move information into the 21st century, but move information law forward as well.

20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for working with some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you address unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $214,000 - $230,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Google's leadership team hand-picks thorny business challenges, and members of BizOps work in small teams to find solutions. As part of this team you fully immerse yourself in data collection, draw insight from analysis, and then zoom out to develop compelling, synthesized recommendations. Taking strategy one step further, you also persuasively communicate your recommendations to senior-level executives, roll-up your sleeves to help drive implementation and check back-in to see the impact of your recommendations.

The Business Operations and Strategy team offers a community with a focus on learning and development.

As an Associate in Business Operations and Strategy, you will own the problem definition, analysis, work planning, and execution of your work streams, and become the “expert” on key data/topics. You will persuasively communicate your recommendations to executives, and influence decisions by building consensus, and mobilizing towards execution. Over time, you will build lasting relationships with colleagues across Alphabet, enabling you to execute rapidly with cross-functional support.

The Business Operations and Strategy team at Google plays a critical role in defining and driving strategic, operational and organizational improvements across the company. Also known as "BizOps", the group operates like an internal consulting group working on a range of critical projects and issues. BizOps creates strategies for promoting growth of our products like YouTube, Chrome and Mobile. They handle issues around partner development, strategy work in emerging markets such as Africa and India, as well as pricing strategies across our B2B and consumer products. The BizOps team is at the forefront of Google's fast-moving strategic priorities, addressing operational challenges and enabling innovation.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $116,000 - $125,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

description:
Being an Analyst at Google is about much more than simply crunching numbers – it’s about finding compelling insights within data and using your exceptional business and communication skills to translate those insights into action. As one of the masterminds behind our strategic planning, forecasting and analysis, you’ll spend your time digging into big, complex data sets. The data will not remain inert in your hands, however, since you’ll use your critical thinking, problem solving and communication skills to influence and drive thoughtful and well-informed decision making with our most senior business leaders within the organization, and potentially some of our biggest clients.

In this role, you will define and manage systems and data aspects of Chrome OS Education and Google Workspace for Education go-to-market. You will be solving different kinds of systems, data, and program management issues. You will identify gaps in processes and data, and drive changes to address these gaps. You will communicate and manage stakeholders at different levels of the business.

Google’s Global Partnerships team powers extraordinary user experiences through partnerships that solve users’ needs, advance our partners’ goals, and further Google’s mission. Our team provides meaningful solutions — from helping publishers and developers grow their businesses through monetization solutions, to helping our long-term partners anticipate and navigate change in a way that delivers economic and reputational value. We build and distribute products through partnerships across a multitude of product areas, including Ads, Search & Assistant, Geo, Platforms & Ecosystems, Devices & Services, Health, Retail, Payments, Next Billion Users, and more. We collaborate across Google, ensuring a coordinated approach when engaging with our most complex and strategic partners.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Salary range of $78,000 - $84,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Business Planning Principal, Industry Solutions
responsibilities:
• Partner with Google Cloud’s Product leadership to define the business strategy and commercialization for Google Cloud’s AI driven Industry Solutions portfolio.
  • Validate the Commercial Business Case for product initiatives launched as part of the Industry Solutions Portfolio.
  • Define innovative packaging and pricing architectures that align to different customer segments and use cases and oversee execution of designed pricing models through launch at scale.
  • Develop value pricing to capture the full business value delivered by Industry Solutions and drive the execution and commercialization of product pricing models.
  • Be a thought partner and challenge Google Cloud leadership to ensure success of Google’s differentiated offerings.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
  • 5 years of experience in commercial economics, pricing, and GTM in a cloud/IT technology company or management consulting across industries

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA or Master's degree in a management, scientific, technical, or engineering field
  • Experience in value pricing/promoting in the cloud/IT technology space
  • Experience working with and challenging the thinking of product/sales organizations on initiatives related to product/solutions commercialization
  • Ability to work cross-functionally across Product, GTM, and Sales organizations
  • Ability to work with and communicate to executives/stakeholders
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

description:
The Business Planning and Commercialization (BPC) team owns Strategic Packaging and Pricing for all Google Cloud.

As part of BPC, our team focuses on Cloud AI, Industry Solutions, and the Technology Partner Ecosystem. We partner with relevant product and partnership teams to enable commercialization of their respective portfolios. We develop use case specific, value based business models for business and technology decision makers of enterprise customers and partners. We work to enable early adopters, cross-product solutions, packaging/pricing with business relevant meters, discounting models, channel economics, planning and optimization, and other strategic initiatives.

In this role, you will drive innovation through all Google Cloud’s business policies and customer agreement structures for Industry Solutions. You will design and manage the packaging, pricing architecture, and price levels for all Google Cloud Industry Solutions. You will design policies and structures with product managers, business partners, and go-to-market (GTM) leads, and influence executive stakeholders to ensure successful rollouts of various programs. Other key responsibilities include guiding the GTM team on commercialization across channels and making sure the pricing design lands as intended.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $147,000 - $158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Business Planning and Pricing Strategy Principal, Cloud Business
responsibilities:
• Develop pricing strategy for new and existing products, including innovative packaging and pricing architectures and value pricing to capture the full business value delivered.
  • Drive creation, development, and implementation of a range of cross-Google Cloud strategic growth initiatives based on proactively-identified opportunities as well as Google Cloud leadership needs.
  • Support commercialization and execution of product and strategic growth initiative launches.
  • Lead and guide collection and quantitative analysis of large amounts of information, derive insightful and actionable recommendations to support strategic packaging and pricing decisions.
  • Act as a thought partner to the Product team and other key stakeholders to ensure optimal operationalization of product and strategic initiative launches.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor degree in a management, scientific, technical, or engineering field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of experience in commercial economics, pricing, valuation, and/or product management in a Cloud/ IT company, management consulting, or private equity across industries.
  • U.S. Citizenship.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA or graduate degree in a management, scientific, technical, or engineering field.
  • Experience working with and challenging the thinking of executive stakeholders on initiatives related to growth and commercialization.
  • Experience leading complex strategic initiatives, and ability to work cross-functionally across Product and Go-to-Market/Sales organizations.
  • Understanding of the business value drivers of Cloud/IT infrastructure products and familiarity with Cloud/IT infrastructure technology, including Value Pricing or Value Selling expertise.
  • Outstanding problem solving and analysis skills, combined with impeccable business judgment.

description:
The Business Planning and Commercialization team owns Strategic Packaging and Pricing for all of Google Cloud, including Google Cloud Platform and Google Workplace. We drive strategic cross-product and cross-functional initiatives for Google Cloud leadership to continuously improve Google Cloud strategy, policies, processes and operationalization to deliver structure for all existing and new products, solutions, programs. We support all Google Cloud products, solutions, agreement structures, programs (product-specific or cross-product), and relevant systems.

In this role, you will have the responsibility to determine and set how Google Cloud makes profit, at the level of individual products and across the entire Google Cloud portfolio. You will partner with Product of a large part of Google Cloud's business and guide the Packaging, Pricing architecture, and Pricing of all Google Cloud products in that portfolio. You will guide the executive leaders of the portfolio to make decisions around product growth and pricing strategy. You will provide thought partnership to Product Managers on their approach. You will pressure test pricing proposals to ensure pricing structure consistency, value pricing, and implementability.

You will also support a range of cross-Google Cloud strategic initiatives that address key challenges and opportunities as identified proactively by the Business Planning and Commercialization team or the executive leadership. By acting as a strategic advisor and consultant, you will guide executive leaders across multiple functions (Product, Sales, Operations, etc) on diagnosing the situation, identifying and selecting recommendations, and developing a plan to implement solutions.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $147,000 - $158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Business Systems Analyst, Data Privacy
responsibilities:
• Partner with compliance, legal, and privacy stakeholders to understand their guidelines and processes and amend our retention and deletion service requirements as needed.
  • Collaborate with product owners and engineering teams across products to ensure they understand the requirements, review their designs to ensure they meet the objectives, and consult on deployment plans.
  • Lead internal systems implementation projects end-to-end (requirements documentation, systems design, test documentation/execution, issue identification, and resolution).
  • Work with cross-functional product teams to ensure successful completion of projects.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 9 years of experience designing first-party solutions, integrations, data modeling, and data analysis.
  • 7 years of experience in system implementation projects.
  • 6 years of experience in data retention, data privacy, and data security.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience designing for the integration of third-party systems with first-party systems.
  • Experience in data architecture and solutions using third-party systems/tools (e.g., Pentaho Kettle, SQL, Informatica, etc.).
  • Understanding of compliance, regulators, and legal data needs related to privacy and data security.

description:
We partner with People Operations (POps) to build first-party products and implement third-party solutions that help drive people’s success.

In this role, you will partner with Legal, Engineering, and People Operations stakeholders to inform our direction and roadmap. We support job architecture, learning and development, global onboarding, POps product security and privacy, and more. In this role, you will focus on protecting data privacy and security of Google applicants, candidates, and employees.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

description:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.

With your technical expertise, you build business applications and influence the design of features that improve the reliability of our applications and systems. You also define the scope of technical projects and oversee execution.

In this role, you will partner with People Operations (POps) to build first-party products and implement third-party solutions that help drive people’s success.

In this role, you will partner with legal, engineering, and People Operations stakeholders to inform our direction and roadmap. We support job architecture, learning and development, global onboarding, POps product security and privacy, and more. In this role, you will focus on the systems that drive Googler learning and growth.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $124,000 - $133,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado..

title: Category Manager, Construction, Procurement
responsibilities:
• Play an integral role in the development of multi-year global category plans and strategies across REWS construction categories (defining buying channels, supply base profiles, purchasing policies, evaluating market trends, supporting supplier discussions).
  • Develop total cost of ownership models for category, and ensure alignment of category plans and strategies to business priorities/functional objectives.
  • Support management of excellent partnerships with key budget owners, Product Area/Functional stakeholders, and strategic suppliers.
  • Be involved in multiple cross-functional teams executing major category initiatives, delivery of maximum value across process, contribute to compliance tracking of category specific policies and performance metrics, and support translation of rapidly evolving category market trends.
  • Drive program level initiatives that create benefits for all procurement activities, improving existing processes, implementing price database, or executing actions to increase diversity.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain and Operations Management, Finance, Business, or relevant fields, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of business experience in procurement.
  • 8 years of multi-disciplined procurement experience.
  • 5 years of category strategy development, sourcing experience, and procurement experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's or advanced degree in a technical field.
  • Experience working in the Technology Industry.
  • Experience supporting initiatives from strategy to execution and delivering results, while managing multiple tasks.
  • Knowledge of construction procurement practices to drive value for key business partners.
  • Ability to drive strategic decisions and influence executives.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

description:
In the Google Procurement Organization (GPO), our aim is to unlock value for Google to reinvest in what matters most. We do this by bringing velocity, efficiency, and security to buying at Google, while partnering across Google to deliver solutions fit for purpose. As a centralized organization operating in a high complexity environment, we support stakeholders and suppliers to ensure the best outcomes. Our organization fosters a culture of collaboration and innovation while providing opportunities for ongoing career growth and development.

The GPO Real Estate and Workplace Services (REWS) Construction Team is responsible for developing and driving category strategies, managing stakeholder relationships, and bringing excellence to Google-wide sourcing, supplier, and contract management for the construction of the Google offices.

As a Category Manager, you will partner closely with key stakeholders to help shape and implement procurement strategies. In this role, you will work in a team environment that is high-growth, fast moving, and constantly changing. You will embrace ambiguity and collaborate across teams to develop procurement approaches and solve complex business problems. You will support operational excellence while being part of an environment where team members can grow, learn, do their best work, and feel appreciated.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $138,000 - $148,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Category Manager, Consulting and Corporate Services
responsibilities:
• Play an integral role in the development of multi-year global category plans and strategies across Consulting and Corporate Services categories, including defining buying channels, supply base profiles, purchasing policies, Supplier Relationship Management (SRM) program, etc.
  • Support alignment of procurement initiatives with stakeholder business objectives through an understanding of business requirements.
  • Be part of of cross-functional teams executing category initiatives, and help ensure delivery of maximum value across the procurement process.
  • Contribute to the compliance tracking of category specific policies, performance metrics, and analysis of market trends and leading practices.
  • Focus on Corporate Services such as People Operations and Finance.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain and Operations Management, Finance, Business, a related field, or equivalent practical experience
  • 7 years of experience in business and 5 years of experience in multi-disciplined procurement
  • 3 years of experience in category strategy development and sourcing within corporate services categories

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA or advanced technical degree
  • Experience working in the technology industry, consulting, or enterprise procurement organizations
  • Experience as a subject matter expert in consulting, staff augmentation, HR Services, finance services, or extended workforces
  • Experience participating on cross-functional and/or global teams
  • Experience supporting initiatives from strategy to execution and delivering results
  • Excellent analytical, problem solving, and communication skills

description:
In the Google Procurement Organization (GPO), our aim is to unlock value for Google to reinvest in what matters most. We do this by bringing velocity, efficiency, and security to buying, while partnering across Google to deliver solutions fit for purpose. As a centralized organization operating in a high complexity environment, we bring clarity to stakeholders and suppliers to ensure the best outcomes. Our organization fosters a culture of collaboration and innovation while providing opportunities for ongoing career growth and development.

As a Category Manager, you will partner with key stakeholders to help shape and implement procurement strategies. The Consulting and Corporate Services Category Management team is responsible for developing and driving holistic category strategies, managing stakeholder relationships, and bringing excellence to Google-wide sourcing, supplier, and agreement management.

In this role, you will work in a team environment that is high-growth, fast moving, and constantly changing. You will embrace ambiguity and collaborate across teams to develop procurement approaches and solve complex business problems. You will support operational excellence while being part of an environment where team members can grow, learn, do their best work, and feel appreciated.

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.

Additional Information(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $138,000 - $148,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Category Manager, Engineering Services and Tech Solutions
responsibilities:
• Develop multi-year global category plans and strategies across the Engineering Services and Tech Solutions category including, defining buying channels, supply base profiles, purchasing policies, future service delivery and engagement models, innovation and continuous improvement program, and digital customer experience management.
  • Develop should cost/total cost of ownership models for the category and ensure alignment of category strategies to business priorities.
  • Operate as a trusted advisor for product areas (e.g., Google Cloud, Ecosystems, Google Search Ads, Platforms, etc.) to drive alignment of Procurement initiatives with stakeholder business objectives and implement category initiatives.
  • Ensure delivery of maximum value across the procurement process, support the translation of rapidly evolving category market trends and leading practices into opportunities for Google.
  • Be the expert/Subject Matter Expert on key industry developments.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain and Operations Management, Finance, Business, or relevant field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in multi-disciplined procurement.
  • 5 years of experience in category strategy development and sourcing within the engineering services and tech solutions category.
  • 10 years of business experience in procurement.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA degree or advanced technical degree.
  • Experience working in the technology industry.
  • Experience participating on cross-functional and/or global teams.
  • Experience supporting initiatives from strategy to execution and delivering results, while managing multiple tasks.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

title: Category Manager, Procurement Mergers and Acquisitions
responsibilities:
• Manage the framework for end-to-end integration of suppliers from acquired companies while aligning procurement processes, operating model, and ways of working. 
  • Execute large scale, highly complex finance programs within the Procurement organization while supporting the due diligence process in setting up clean rooms for spend and contract analysis. 
  • Develop and supervise the integration of various work streams, project planning, status reporting, timeline estimation, issue tracking, facilitating meetings, and documenting processes/connecting cross category.
  • Define category operational goals and objectives and develop recommendations in the form of identified synergies and value realization.
  • Drive supplier relationship and performance management for key strategic cross-category suppliers acting as a thought leader to drive continuous improvement, best practice sharing, and training for supplier management processes and tools.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain and Operations Management, Finance, Business, related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of business experience in procurement.
  • 8 years of multi-disciplined procurement experience.
  • 5 years of experience in category strategy development and sourcing.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Advanced technical degree or MBA.
  • Experience working in the technology industry.
  • Experience participating on cross-functional or global teams.
  • Experience supporting initiatives from strategy to execution.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks with excellent analytical, problem solving, and communication skills.
  • Excellent project management skills within the procurement category.

title: Chrome Extensions Developer Relations Engineer
responsibilities:
• Advocate the adoption of Chrome Extensions to strategic partners and the developer community with a focus on identifying opportunities for ecosystems and platforms to come to the extension ecosystem.
  • Provide technical guidance and expertise to partner teams adopting the extension ecosystem about best practices, bug resolution, and what topics might be relevant to them.
  • Work with the extension ecosystem to improve the quality of extensions by being a central and trusted contact for developers and drive adoption of new Extension capabilities such as Service Workers
  • Understand the many various Chrome Extension projects in the ecosystem and other browser vendors and provide guidance on which projects are worth highlighting and advocating for changes to the platform.
  • Advocate for developers internally and influence Google developer product strategy by working with Product Management, Engineering, and other cross-functional teams.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 5 years of experience in software development.
  • Experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
  • Experience working directly with third-party developers.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience as an active participant in technical/ developer communities, open source projects, or similar developer groups
  • Experience working with on the bleeding edge of the web platform, and blogging and writing technical articles.
  • Excellent knowledge of web technologies (HTTP, HTML, JavaScript)
  • Expertise in web security and/or Chrome extensions.

description:
Developer Programs Engineers collaborate with developers at conferences and online, and advocate for developers interests internally at Google. You will write sample code and client libraries as well as participate in developer forums and support queues to troubleshoot and debug coding problems developers encounter. Internally, you work with product engineering teams improve our products. You will drive strategy around fostering a community of developers who work with Google technologies and represent their voice internally.

The Web and Chrome Developer Relations team is focused on supporting the long term health of the Chrome and web platforms by working with developers to create the guidance and tools, samples and apps they need to be successful. We want to make it easy for web developers to build great experiences quickly on the web and in Chrome. We work with Product teams to convey feedback from developers to help identify and prioritize changes to the platform and we work with developers to help build next-generation experiences using Chrome Extensions.

You will focus on shaping the future of the Chrome Extension ecosystem by deeply understanding the ecosystem around extensions with activities ranging from inspiring developers with the latest advancements in the extension platform to educating the industry on the possibilities of Chrome Extensions. You will also have a strong focus on the creation and development of best practices by working closely with partner developers both big and small to understand their needs and work closely with the engineering team to prioritize the direction of both the Chrome Extension core features and the toolchain around it.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range of $130,000 - $139,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

  • Advocate for developers and other technical practitioners internally, and influence Google Cloud developer product strategy by working with Product Management, Engineering, Support, Public Relations, Marketing, Business Development, and other cross-functional teams.
  • Consult with external developers to ensure successful implementation of products. Create momentum and drive the success of the product.
qualifications:

  • Experience working with developer communities.
  • Experience working with compute, networking, or storage.
  • Experience creating technical content (e.g, blogs, technical articles, tutorials, videos, etc.).
  • Ability to foster cross-team, cross-role, and cross-organization/product area partnerships.

title: Cloud Developer Programs Engineer, Google Cloud
responsibilities:
• Build idiomatic client libraries/SDKs/connectors, code samples, and other developer tools to improve the developer experience of using Google’s platforms and APIs.

description:
The Data Analytics Developer Relations Engineering team is part of the Developer Relations (DevRel) organization. We are responsible for crafting the developer experience for Google Cloud Platform (GCP) developers in the Data Analytics space, including BigQuery, Pub/Sub, Dataflow, Composer, and others.

We author SDKs/client libraries, and provide feedback on API design, platform consistency, and functionality. We write sample code and work with our technical writing teams to produce developer documentation, quickstarts and tutorials. We release open source code, participate in developer forums, help troubleshoot developer problems, and engage with product engineering teams to help them understand the developer experience as a critical part of the platform.

As part of the Data Analytics team you will work cross-functionally and with external developers to directly and indirectly improve the developer experience.

In this role, you will build and improve BigQuery Python client libraries and connectors, and improve the BigQuery and cross-product experience for working with data science and analytics-focused products in the Data Analytics product portfolio.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $110,000 - $118,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

responsibilities:

description:
The Google Cloud CISO team is the integrated risk, security, compliance and privacy team. The Office of the CISO is the team helping customers on their secure digital transformation.

The Google Cybersecurity Action Team is a security advisory team and has a singular mission of supporting the security and digital transformation of governments, critical infrastructure, enterprises, and small business.

In this role, you will enable the wide-scale adoption of Google Cloud by the world’s largest enterprises, in any industry and in any market. You will establish Google Cloud as the most trusted cloud and the most effective partner for security transformation, by positioning and delivering security and compliance capabilities that are a key differentiator, and by demonstrating the opportunity for operational risk reduction in key industries and geographies.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) $139,000 + bonus + equity + benefits
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Content Strategist, Google Ads
responsibilities:
• Work closely with stakeholders to define the content strategy and requirements for the Google Ads and/or commerce platform for a global audience. Align on priorities and set expectations for available support, resources, and expected timelines.
  • Scope, propose, and drive content initiatives, projects, and experiments designed to improve customer outcomes.
  • Monitor and report content metrics that measure performance to identify opportunities for scalable solutions.
  • Present findings, successes, opportunities, and insights to the content team as well as organizational leadership.
  • Balance customer/user experience and business impact with speed and quality.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of experience in content development, production, or program/project management for a technology company and/or website.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience driving content changes that improve customer and business outcomes.
  • Experience leading data-driven projects and communicating results and insights to cross-functional partners.
  • Experience designing experiments and conducting A/B testing.
  • Experience contributing at both strategic and operational levels with Product, Operations, Analytics, and UX teams.
  • Experience initiating and driving projects to completion with minimal guidance or support, while also being an open, collaborative team player.
  • Knowledge of Google Ads and related ads products, and understanding of Google’s support ecosystem and industry landscape.

description:
gTech’s Product and Tools Operations team (gPTO) leverages deep user, operational, and technical insights to innovate Google's Ads products into customer experiences that are so intuitive (or automated) that they require no support at all. gPTO partners closely with gTech’s Support, Professional Services, Product Management, and Engineering teams to innovate and simplify our Ads products and build the productivity tools ecosystem for gTech users.

As a Content Strategist for the Google Ads Content Strategy team, you will define, manage, and lead complex projects in the help content space. You’ll be central to the execution of cross-functional initiatives to improve the accuracy, consumability, and discoverability of help content.

In this role, you will own the overarching strategies to develop content solutions at scale. You’ll gather data, propose initiatives and experiments to improve business and customer outcomes, and scale learnings. You’ll be responsible for creating, implementing, and evaluating data-driving projects for the Google Ads content ecosystem. You will help solve business issues such as customer satisfaction and self-service.

Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of trusted advisors support customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $109,000 - $117,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Content Strategy Manager, UX
responsibilities:
• Manage and own the output of a team of content strategists developing and producing high quality content at scale across a range of products.
  • Help manage team operations (e.g., developing processes and workflows to increase efficiency, driving quality standards, and successfully balancing workloads).
  • Work with product managers, UX researchers and designers, and marketing groups to ensure cross-functional collaboration and prioritization across teams.
  • Develop and scope team projects that map to critical business goals.
qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience

  • 3 years of experience managing UX writing teams
  • Portfolio of UX-focused writing samples and style guidelines for web and mobile applications

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with user-focused product writing (e.g., work in hardware, software, digital agency, or other relevant product area)
  • Experience working with user research and analyzing customer feedback
  • Experience with localization and/or creating content for global audiences
  • Experience writing for voice and/or video
  • Ability to help define and maintain brand voice and tailor content for mobile experiences

description:
As a Content Strategy Manager, you will be part of a leadership team focused on delivering compelling, informative, and engaging user experiences across a broad range of geographic, travel, and search products. In this role, you will help define and drive the future of content strategy at Google. You will focus on performance and impact, providing opportunities for your team to reach their potential and to develop their skills and careers.

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $169,000 - $181,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Conversational Commerce Product Manager, Business Messaging
responsibilities:
• Defining strategy and roadmaps for enabling/expanding messaging on various shopping journeys in Google.
  • Lead execution for launching messaging entry-points to connect users with the merchants on shopping queries and shopping property.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams and stakeholders (e.g., engineering, design, business development, UXR, and program management).
  • Engage regularly as a trusted advisor with merchants and partners to understand their messaging strategies, pain points, and priorities to inform product strategy. 
  • Analyze industry conversational commerce trends to manage innovation.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in product management (i.e. creating product roadmaps from conception to launch and working with cross-functional teams).
  • Experience managing elements of the product development lifecycle (e.g., product plans, Go-to-Market strategy, managing requirements, and product launch).
  • Experience in developing internet products and technologies.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Advanced degree in a technology or business related field.
  • Experience with messaging platform and/or conversational commerce.
  • Ability to connect with internal and external partners regularly.
  • Ability to adapt to rapid change and think about challenges from a fresh perspective.
  • Excellent communication skills.

description:
At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users

In this role you will focus on building meaningful connections among users and businesses. You will enable users to connect with businesses directly through messaging from different Google surfaces including Search, Maps, Shopping, Ads, etc.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $174,000 - $187,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

Android is Google’s open-source mobile operating system powering more than 3 billion devices worldwide. Android is about bringing computing to everyone in the world. We believe computing is a super power for good, enabling access to information, economic opportunity, productivity, connectivity between friends and family and more. We think everyone in the world should have access to the best computing has to offer. We provide the platform for original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and developers to build compelling computing devices (smartphones, tablets, TVs, wearables, etc) that run the best apps/services for everyone in the world.

title: Customer Engineer, Identity and Network Security, Chrome Enterprise
responsibilities:
• Lead enterprise customers, security systems providers, partners, and government agencies to ease their transition to Chrome Enterprise.
  • Work with the Sales and Product teams to help customers and partners understand Google Chrome security systems, technical features, address integration challenges, and key technical issues.
  • Manage Chrome Enterprise as a secure solution encompassing Chrome Browser, Chrome OS, and management capabilities.
  • Collaborate with the Product Management, Marketing, and Engineering teams to stay current in security requirements ,trends, and device enhancements to Google's Chrome Platform.
qualifications:

  • 3 years of experience in certificate authority providers.
  • 3 years of experience in network security.
  • 3 years of experience in identity systems (e.g., OpenID, Security Assertion Markup Language, or other cloud-based identity).
  • 3 years of experience with security technologies/encryption such as Certificate Transparency (CT), Secure Sockets Layer, IP Security, certificate management protocols, etc.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with application development across web, Android, and Enterprise applications and services.
  • 3 years of experience in technical partnership management specializing in security.
  • Excellent technical, presentation, communication, and organizational skills.

responsibilities:

  • Create value for customers by partnering to define success and build a joint plan with identified objectives, stakeholders, milestones, risks, and metrics needed to achieve their goals.
  • Form strategic relationships with stakeholders to understand a customer’s business within their industry and develop strategic road maps.
  • Guide IT executives through the organizational changes needed to unlock the full value of the cloud, and help them staff, train, and align their team members and partners to deliver on their cloud transformation.

qualifications:
