  • Experience in leading delivery teams, migration, implementation, or managed services operations of technology services engagements for organizations

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in a management, technical, or engineering field
  • 20 years of experience working in customer-facing roles
  • Experience with data center migration strategies, collaborating with channel partners, and systems integrators
  • Experience helping customers decide how to make investments in new technologies and projects based on expected value and return on investment
  • Knowledge of Google Cloud ecosystem

description:
Our Cloud Customer Experience (CCE) team helps customers transform IT organizations to build and operate modern, cloud-native applications using Google Cloud’s products and services and ensure that customers are able to maximize their investments.

As a Cloud Customer Experience Account Lead (CCE), you will act as a trusted advisor to Google Cloud’s customers by enabling them to use Google’s Cloud products to achieve their business objectives. You will partner with customers to develop and execute cloud success plans: organizational, programmatic, and technical strategies to meet their business objectives and stakeholder goals. You will work with customers to remove organizational and technical barriers and identify opportunities to help customers expand their use of Google Cloud products. Further, you will leverage your industry expertise to recommend best practices relevant to their industry and organizational changes to accelerate their onboarding and migration plans.

You will lead the successful adoption of Google Cloud, guiding customers through the people, process, and technology facets of their Google Cloud transformation journey. You will work across customer-facing teams to ensure that a customer’s experience on Google Cloud exceeds their expectations. As a CCE Account Lead, you will deeply understand the customer’s industry and business objectives and regularly engage with executive stakeholders across a cross-functional and geographically dispersed team to ensure Google is helping them achieve their goals.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

title: DRM Security Engineer, Widevine Security
responsibilities:

qualifications:

Preferred qualifications:

  • Software development experience in C++ or Java.
  • Experience in code protection and code obfuscation techniques.
  • Experience in white-box cryptography.
  • Knowledge of applied cryptography and security protocols.

description:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.

As a DRM Security Engineer, you will help ensure that our software and systems are designed and implemented to the highest security standards. You will perform technical security assessments, code reviews, and vulnerability testing to highlight risk, helping Google teams and partners to improve security. You will also work closely with other Google Engineers to design and build proactive methods to enhance our security.

We build DRM solutions which provide the capability to license, securely distribute and protect playback of content on Chrome, Android, Chromecast, and many other consumer devices.

At Google, our users come first, and the Systems Infrastructure team is at the heart of that promise. We build the technologies that transform the way we think about doing business. Whether working on our cloud systems, researching the latest in computer technology or keeping Google's internal systems humming, Googlers and users alike rely on us to keep things running. We're back-end experts: protecting your privacy and ensuring your security.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $142,000 - $153,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Data Scientist Intern, MS, Summer 2022
responsibilities:
• Work with large complex data sets, solve difficult non-routine analysis problems, and apply advanced analytical methods as needed. Conduct end-to-end analysis, including data collection, requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations.
  • Build and prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale. Develop a comprehensive understanding of Google data structures and metrics, advocating for changes.
  • Interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of people and teams. Work closely with engineers to identify opportunities, design and assess improvements to Google products.
  • Make business recommendations (e.g., cost-benefit, forecasting, experiment analysis) with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative information.
  • Research and develop analysis, forecasting and optimization methods to improve the quality of Google's user-facing products, such as ads quality, search quality, end-user behavioral modeling, and live experiments.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Pursuing a Master's degree in Statistics, Data Science, or similar quantitative discipline.
  • Experience with statistical software (R, Python, S-Plus, SAS, or similar) and with database languages (e.g., SQL).
  • Experience with data analysis.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Currently attending a degree program in the US with plans to return to the degree program after completion of the internship.
  • Available to work full-time for a minimum of 12 weeks outside of university-term time.
  • Experience with statistical data analysis, such as linear models, multivariate analysis, stochastic models, and sampling methods.
  • Ability to draw conclusions from data and recommend actions.
  • Demonstrated leadership, self-direction and willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques.

description:
Join us for a unique 12-14 week paid internship that offers personal and professional development, an executive speaker series, and community-building.

At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. Data Scientists/Analysts work all across the organization to help shape Google's business and technical strategies by processing, analyzing, and interpreting huge data sets. Using analytical excellence and statistical methods, you mine through data to identify opportunities for Google and our clients to operate more efficiently, from enhancing advertising efficacy to network infrastructure optimization to studying user behavior. As an analyst, you do more than just crunch the numbers. You work with Engineers, Product Managers, Sales Associates and Marketing teams to adjust Google's practices according to your findings. Identifying the problem is only half the job; you also figure out the solution. As a key member of the team, you will work with engineers to analyze and interpret data, develop metrics to measure results and integrate new methodologies into existing systems.
application_instruction:
Please complete your application before April 21st, 2022.

Participation in the internship program requires that you are located in the United States for the duration of the internship program.

This internship is intended for students who are currently pursuing a Master's degree in statistics, data science, or similar quantitative discipline with an anticipated graduation date on or before June 2023, depending on their program and unique circumstances.

  • To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English. Click on the “Apply” button on this page and provide the required materials in the appropriate sections (PDFs preferred):
    • In the “Resume” section, upload an updated CV or resume. In your CV or resume, please ensure to list your anticipated graduation date (MM/YY) and any proficiency in statistical software and database languages, along with any technical experience or projects.
    • In the “Higher education” section, select “Now attending” under “Degree Status" and upload the most recent unofficial or official transcript in English.

    This role may also be located in our Playa Vista, CA campus.

title: Data Scientist, Operations Data Science
responsibilities:
• Lead projects with hands-on analysis and modeling, drawing from multiple of analytical methods to choose the right tool and right level of complexity appropriate for the business challenges.
  • Engage broadly with the organization to identify, prioritize, frame, and structure complex and ambiguous challenges, where advanced analytics projects or tools can have the biggest impact.
  • Identify and communicate the challenges and opportunities that the group should be working on.
  • Help define the analytical direction and influence the direction of the associated engineering and infrastructure work.
  • Articulate business questions and use mathematical techniques to arrive at an answer using data. Translate analysis results into business recommendations.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Statistics, related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of relevant work experience (e.g., as a data scientist) or equivalent. Analytical engagements outside class work while at school can be included.
  • Experience with statistical software (e.g., R, Python) and database languages (e.g., SQL)

Preferred qualifications:

  • PhD in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Statistics or related field.
  • 4 years of relevant work experience (e.g., as a data scientist), including experience applying advanced analytics to planning and infrastructure problems.
  • Experience designing and building statistical forecasting models.
  • Experience designing and building machine learning models.
  • Excellent problem-framing, problem-solving and project management skills.
  • Excellent customer service and team collaboration skills.

description:
At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. Data Scientists work all across the organization to help shape Google's business and technical strategies by processing, analyzing and interpreting huge data sets. Using analytical rigor and statistical methods, you mine through data to identify opportunities for Google and our clients to operate more efficiently, from enhancing advertising efficacy to network infrastructure optimization to studying user behavior. As an analyst, you do more than just crunch the numbers. You work with Engineers, Product Managers, Sales Associates and Marketing teams to adjust Google's practices according to your findings. Identifying the problem is only half the job; you also figure out the solution.

As a member of the Operations Data Science team, you will apply operations research and statistical methods to solve challenges related to compute, storage, network, and datacenter capacity for both Google’s internal services and Google Cloud Platform. You will work broadly across Google’s Platforms Engineering, Systems Infrastructure, and Site Reliability Engineering teams to optimize our deployment of resources and drive innovation in our software stack, allowing for efficient use of resources.

As a Data Scientist, you will think critically and strategically about Google’s cloud as a technology, a business, and as an operation. You will be comfortable discussing total cost of management with hardware engineers, resource optimization with software engineers, or reviewing fleet plans and deployment policies with operations executives, all based upon the analytical models that you will be developing.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $135,000 - $145,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Developer Programs Engineer, Cloud Logging, Operations Management
responsibilities:
• Implement, release, and manage open source SDKs, APIs, demo apps, tools, samples, blog posts, technical guides, or videos. Contribute to and manage open source projects and drive open standards.
  • Advocate for developers internally and influence Google developer product strategy by working with Product Management, Go-to-Market, Engineering, Support, PR, Marketing, Business Development, and other cross-functional teams.
  • Manage and participate in developer discussion forums, and troubleshoot/address the developer experience challenges raised in these forums. Educate developers on best practices for effective integration of Google developer products.
  • Propose the integration of features that change how users interact with Google Operations Management products.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
  • Experience in Python, Go, Ruby, Node, Java, .NET, or PHP

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with observability-related technology, including logging, tracing, monitoring, and debugging
  • Experience as a contributor to an open source project
  • Experience developing, deploying, and operating on a cloud computing platform
  • Experience working with third-party developer tools, including creating documentation, APIs, Software Development Kits (SDKs), and client libraries

description:
As a Developer Programs Engineer (DPE), you will ensure that Google Cloud and related open source projects work well for developers. You will provide feedback on API design, platform consistency, and functionality. You will write sample code and work with our Technical Writing teams to produce developer documentation, quickstarts, and tutorials. You will manage source code, participate in developer forums, and help troubleshoot developer problems.You will also work on Google Operations Management products by helping our customers successfully enable logging, tracing, and monitoring best practices in their production environments. You will work with multiple programming languages and develop an understanding of the needs of developers who will need to instrument their code and the operators who will need to efficiently operate cloud services at scale.

description:
Developer Programs Engineers are the engineering portion of the Google Workspace Developer Relations team. We ensure that the Google Workspace platform and APIs are amazing for developers and partners. We're among the first developers to use upcoming services. We author Software Development Kits (SDKs)/client libraries, and provide feedback on API design, platform consistency, and functionality. We write sample code and work with our technical writing teams to produce developer documentation, quick-starts, and tutorials. We release open source code, participate in developer forums, and help troubleshoot developer problems.

As part of the Google Workspace Developer Relations team you will work cross-functionally and with external developers to directly and indirectly improve the developer experience.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $109,000 - $117,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

description:
Passionate people are everywhere at Google. In Developer Relations, we get excited to collaborate and connect with the communities that love technology as much as we do. Part community manager and part developer advocate, Developer Programs Engineers collaborate with developers at conferences and online, and advocate for developers interests internally at Google. Not afraid to be hands-on, you write sample code and client libraries as well as participate in developer forums and support queues to troubleshoot and debug coding problems developers encounter. Internally, you work with product engineering teams improve our products by conveying feedback from developers, reviewing API designs and testing new features. Chrome, Android, App Engine, HTML5 as well as our core Google Apps and Ads APIs are just some of the platforms you promote and support.

With your technical expertise, you drive strategy around fostering a community of developers who work with Google technologies. An ardent advocate for these developers, you represent their voice internally to our Product Managers and serve as their Google support in application development and technology implementation.

The mission of this team is to empower every creator to build a successful business on the web.

The future of Search depends on a healthy creator ecosystem. The goal of our team is to help creators be more successful on the web by providing guidance and tooling.

description:
Passionate people are everywhere at Google. In Developer Relations, we are excited to collaborate and connect with the communities that love technology as much as we do. Part community manager and part developer advocate, Developer Programs Engineers collaborate with developers at conferences and online, and advocate for developers interests internally at Google. Not afraid to be hands-on, you write sample code and client libraries as well as participate in developer forums and support queues to troubleshoot and debug coding problems developers encounter. Internally, you work with product engineering teams to improve our products by conveying feedback from developers, reviewing API designs, and testing new features. Chrome, Android, App Engine, HTML5, and our core Google Workspace and Ads APIs are just some of the platforms you promote and support.

As a Developer Relations Engineer, you will manage technical relationships with partners and provide engineering support and guidance to them. You will help drive developer strategy with Product teams, acting as the representative of your partners to bring mutually beneficial features to the market.

Users come first at Google. Nowhere is this more important than on our Advertising and Commerce team: we believe that ads and commercial information can be highly useful to our users if that information is relevant to what our users wish to find or do. Advertisers worldwide use Google Ads to promote their products; publishers use AdSense to serve relevant ads on their website; and business around the world use our products (like Google Shopping, and Google Wallet) to support their online businesses and bring users into their offline stores. We are constantly innovating to deliver the most effective advertising and commerce opportunities of tomorrow.

Additional Information
Minimum salary range between $109,000 - $117,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

description:
Passionate people are everywhere at Google. In Developer Relations, we are excited to collaborate and connect with the communities that love technology as much as we do. Part community manager and part developer advocate, Developer Programs Engineers collaborate with developers at conferences and online, and advocate for developers interests internally at Google. Not afraid to be hands-on, you write sample code and client libraries as well as participate in developer forums and support queues to troubleshoot and debug coding problems developers encounter. Internally, you work with product engineering teams to improve our products by conveying feedback from developers, reviewing API designs, and testing new features. Chrome, Android, App Engine, HTML5, and our core Google Workspace and Ads APIs are just some of the platforms you promote and support.

Our team’s mission is to drive partner success with engineering direction and support, accelerating adoption of Android and Google Play technologies. Our focus is on supporting major third-party developers who build applications for Android and Google Play.

As a Developer Relations Engineer, you will manage technical relationships with partners and provide engineering support and guidance to them. You will help drive developer strategy with product teams, acting as the representative of your partners to bring mutually beneficial features to market.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $109,000 - $117,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
In Developer Relations, we collaborate and connect with the communities that love technology as much as we do.

As a Developer Relations Engineer, you will work with developers and represent their needs and perspectives. You'll use technical and ecosystem knowledge to actively engage with developers and partners globally. You will educate developers on best practices, write sample code and client libraries, debug coding and other technical issues, and drive developer experience improvements. You'll work internally with Engineering and Product teams as an advocate for developers, and you’ll manage technical relationships with partners and provide them with engineering support and guidance. You will also help drive developer success and deeper engagement/adoption.

The Core team builds the technical foundation behind Google’s flagship products. We are owners and advocates for the underlying design elements, developer platforms, product components, and infrastructure at Google. These are the essential building blocks for excellent, safe, and coherent experiences for our users and drive the pace of innovation for every developer. We look across Google’s products to build central solutions, break down technical barriers and strengthen existing systems. As the Core team, we have a mandate and a unique opportunity to impact important technical decisions across the company.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $109,000 - $117,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
The Dart and Flutter Developer Relations team grows and supports the Dart and Flutter developer communities. We onboard and retain new developers by building a positive, smart, and approachable culture, providing resources to help them succeed, and advocating on their behalf. Some of our projects include: learning tools like online code editors, learning resources like Google Developers Codelabs, Docs, and sample applications, outreach via channels like video, social media, and in-person events, product excellence programs, and worldwide community of meetups, Google developer groups, and other Flutter groups.As a Developer Relations Engineer for Dart and Flutter Developer Relations, you'll join a growing community of developers using Flutter to build apps for mobile, web, and desktop. You will write sample code, advocate for improvements to pain points, create scalable developer resources, and more. You will contribute to the content of Flutter's YouTube channel and become one of Flutter's public representatives. You will also work across teams and drive collaborative improvements, as Flutter integrates with other Google products and services.

The Core team builds the technical foundation behind Google’s flagship products. We are owners and advocates for the underlying design elements, developer platforms, product components, and infrastructure at Google. description:
Passionate people are everywhere at Google. In Developer Relations, we are excited to collaborate and connect with the communities that love technology as much as we do. Part community manager and part developer advocate, Developer Programs Engineers collaborate with developers at conferences and online, and advocate for developers interests internally at Google. Not afraid to be hands-on, you write sample code and client libraries as well as participate in developer forums and support queues to troubleshoot and debug coding problems developers encounter. Internally, you work with product engineering teams to improve our products by conveying feedback from developers, reviewing API designs, and testing new features. Chrome, Android, App Engine, HTML5, and our core Google Workspace and Ads APIs are just some of the platforms you promote and support.

Fuchsia is an open-source operating system designed to support long-lasting products and experiences across a broad range of devices. Our mission is to engage developers and help them adopt Fuchsia.

As a Developer Relations Engineer, you will write code, connect with developers, and communicate about technologies. Your work will foster a community of developers integrating with Fuchsia, and help to drive strategy around Developer Relations.

Our focus is on supporting both internal and third-party developers who build applications and businesses on Fuchsia. You will write tools, sample code, author libraries, or work with strategic partners to facilitate their integration.

Additional Information

title: Developer Relations Engineer, Google Photos
responsibilities:
• Assist partners and third-party developers in the Google Photos partner program to understand Google Photos APIs and services, and troubleshoot partner integrations with other Google developer products.
  • Work with Google product source code with other engineers to identify, reproduce, and fix issues that affect our developers and their users.
  • Advocate for developers and influence Google developer product strategy by working with cross-functional teams, including the Google Photos leadership team.

qualifications:

description:
In Internal Developer Relations, we collaborate and connect with communities that love technology as much as we do. Our team interacts with developers across Google at conferences as well as online, and advocates for developer interests and needs internally at Google. Our focus is on supporting first-party developers who build applications for Google products and supporting Google's infrastructure platforms.

In this role, you will write sample code, author client libraries, working with strategic partners and teams to facilitate and organize our developer communities. As a Developer Relations Manager, you will connect with developers and speak about cutting-edge technologies on conference panels and classes. Your work will foster a community of developers within Google and will help drive strategy around developer relations. You will create codelabs, run trainings, support developers to troubleshoot and debug technical problems encountered by developers. In collaboration with infrastructure teams, you will improve products by conveying feedback from developers, reviewing and contributing to API designs, writing production ready code, and testing new features.

The Core team builds the technical foundation behind Google’s flagship products. We are owners and advocates for the underlying design elements, developer platforms, product components, and infrastructure at Google. These are the essential building blocks for excellent, safe, and coherent experiences for our users and drive the pace of innovation for every developer. We look across Google’s products to build central solutions, break down technical barriers and strengthen existing systems. As the Core team, we have a mandate and a unique opportunity to impact important technical decisions across the company.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $180,000 - $194,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

  • Experience creating public facing content
  • Knowledge of Kaggle platform
  • Knowledge of data analysis techniques to detect abusive patterns, outliers, sentiment, plagiarism, brigading, etc.
  • Clear communication skills

description:
Google’s Cloud Platform’s core infrastructure products include Compute Engine, Networking, and Storage solutions that enable businesses to serve customers with excellent experiences using Google’s global computing infrastructure. Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible.

In this role, you will join the Google Cloud Systems and Services Infrastructure (S2Infra) team. You'll shape the future of our core infrastructure products and internal tooling and help grow our infrastructure business. You will balance thinking big with a focus on craft, influencing others, mentoring, and managing managers, designers, researchers, and technologists to deliver excellent work.

You will use your business acumen and extensive industry knowledge to define and drive the future of Google’s Cloud products. You will identify and drive UX at scale, making complex UX ecosystems simple and enabling teams to push the boundaries of what’s possible. You have built UX systems at scale, understand how to integrate existing design systems into solutions that will scale development for internal and external users.

You will apply your passion for UX at scale, love of tooling to remove daily toil, guide research and design processes, mentor the team, and collaborate with leaders of other UX, Product Management, and Engineering teams to create velocity for Google’s Cloud Platform.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $265,000 - $285,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

In this role, you will be responsible for owning specific processes across functions, geographies, and business units. You will act as the main authority, designer, and decision-maker for Google Cloud’s Order to Cash process.

You will bring domain expertise in the opportunity to the agreement space, influencing stakeholders across the business. You will understand the opportunities and challenges of different approaches, and the needs of systems and internal customers.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

description:
The Android Apps Safety Engineering team (AASE) develops software to ensure a safe and high quality experience for users of Android apps. We protect users in the Android ecosystem by using ML and human reviews to detect policy violations that include but not limited to: mobile-malware, and content and behavior abuse.

As an Engineering Manager on this team, you will lead, manage, and grow a team of software engineers who will build tools and frameworks for enhanced store safety and security.

Android is Google’s open-source mobile operating system powering more than 3 billion devices worldwide. Android is about bringing computing to everyone in the world. We believe computing is a super power for good, enabling access to information, economic opportunity, productivity, connectivity between friends and family and more. We think everyone in the world should have access to the best computing has to offer. We provide the platform for original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and developers to build compelling computing devices (smartphones, tablets, TVs, wearables, etc) that run the best apps/services for everyone in the world.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $198,000 - $212,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Like Google's own ambitions, the work of a Software Engineer (SWE) goes way beyond just Search. SWE Managers have not only the technical expertise to take on and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs. As a SWE Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our exceptional software engineers are just getting started -- and as a manager, you guide the way.

The Google Play Store App Distribution Team is at the core of the vibrant Android app ecosystem. We are contributing to Google Play’s mission to connect users to great digital experiences.

We work closely with numerous product areas across Google (Android, Chrome), OEMs, carriers, and developers to ensure and are operating at billions scale.

We have exciting plans to significantly improve performance, scale, and reach of app distribution in 2022 and as an Engineering Manager you'll help us reach these goals.

Google Play offers music, movies, books, apps and games for devices, powered by the cloud. It syncs across devices and on the web. As part of the Android and Mobile team, Googlers working on Google Play do everything from engineering our backend systems, to shaping product strategy, to forming great content partnerships. They make it possible for people to do things like buy an ebook or song on their Android phone, then have it instantly available on their laptop. The Google Play team enhances the Android ecosystem by giving developers and partners a premium store where they can reach millions of users.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $198,000 - $212,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Like Google's own ambitions, the work of a Software Engineer (SWE) goes way beyond just Search. SWE Managers have not only the technical expertise to take on and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs. As a SWE Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our exceptional software engineers are just getting started -- and as a manager, you guide the way.

Chrome Browser has active users all over the world, and one of our largest growth opportunities lies in enterprise environments. Businesses bring a unique set of needs and challenges for software deployed in their environments. Our team understands those needs and builds technology to help organizations succeed. The Chrome Enterprise team focuses on developing features that solve issues for companies and organizations who deploy and manage Chrome on fleets of devices (e.g., desktop and mobile).

Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas, and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.

Google is an engineering company at heart. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on users around the world. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, social to local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

Additional Information

description:
Like Google's own ambitions, the work of a Software Engineer (SWE) goes way beyond just Search. SWE Managers have not only the technical expertise to take on and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs. As a SWE Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our exceptional software engineers are just getting started -- and as a manager, you guide the way.

The Fuchsia Tools team delivers a robust, scalable tooling platform for all Fuchsia developers. Specifically, we are responsible for FFX (i.e., Fuchsia's primary host-side CLI tool which runs on Linux), Fuchsia's on-device developer services, and their communication protocols. These tools are used across Google as well as Fuchsia's emerging open-source community. Our mission is to enable and delight Fuchsia developers with all aspects of Fuchsia development.

As the team's Engineering Manager, you will manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your teams' careers and growth. Operating with scale and speed, our exceptional software engineers are just getting started - and as a manager, you will guide the way.

Google is an engineering company at heart. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on users around the world. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, social to local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $198,000 - $212,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) combines software and systems engineering to build and run large-scale, massively distributed, fault-tolerant systems. SRE ensures that Google's services—both our internally critical and our externally-visible systems—have reliability, uptime appropriate to users' needs and a fast rate of improvement. Additionally SRE’s will keep an ever-watchful eye on our systems capacity and performance. Much of our software development focuses on optimizing existing systems, building infrastructure and eliminating work through automation.

On the SRE team, you’ll have the opportunity to manage the complex challenges of scale which are unique to Google, while using your expertise in coding, algorithms, complexity analysis and large-scale system design.

SRE's culture of diversity, intellectual curiosity, problem solving and openness is key to its success. Our organization brings together people with a wide variety of backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. We encourage them to collaborate, think big and take risks in a blame-free environment. We promote self-direction to work on meaningful projects, while we also strive to create an environment that provides the support and mentorship needed to learn and grow.

To learn more: check out our books on Site Reliability Engineering, watch a recorded Hangout on Air to meet some of our SREs, or read a career profile about why a Software Engineer chose to join SRE.

As an Engineering Manager, you'll lead a team and be responsible for products globally, providing technical leadership to key projects and empowering and developing teams to do the same.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

description:
Fuchsia is an open source, general purpose operating system. It's designed from the kernel up for security, updatability, and flexibility. It is a platform to build products, not a specific end-user product.

The WLAN Drivers team develops the platform for wireless networking on Fuchsia devices. We build the APIs, libraries, and tools for writing these drivers, as well as the first WLAN drivers that run on Fuchsia.

The WLAN Drivers team has been developing the set of drivers that connect to wireless networks on Fuchsia devices. We've learned a lot along the way, but this approach won't scale forever. As we expand our support to more WLAN chipsets, the team will engage with our partners and enable them to own their drivers. We also support Fuchsia's goal of binary stable interfaces for drivers, allowing drivers to be updated independently from the rest of the system.

As Software Engineering Manager, you'll manage the team as we balance existing priorities with the strategic changes needed to scale to a diverse hardware ecosystem for Fuchsia devices. We work with other teams in the connectivity stack as well as the Driver Framework team as we design our APIs.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $198,000 - $212,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

description:
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As the Partner Development Manager (PDM), you will own the engagement with partners for our North American business. You will be responsible for driving an aligned co-promote motion, practice development, business growth, and developing offerings for our Google Cloud Solution Portfolio with partners.

You will develop partner-specific strategies and work with executives of the companies, as well as across a broad range of internal stakeholders.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary of $153,000 - $164,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
The Consumer Leadership Recruiting team at Google is a focused group who are responsible for hiring at the Leadership level (Director and VP) across Ads, Search, Geo, YouTube, Commerce and Payments. Our work is focused on critical leadership roles that will have a direct impact on the future of these businesses and Google.

As a Researcher on the Core Computing Executive Recruiting team, you'll focus on finding and hiring leadership talent who will help build, deliver, and drive our innovative technologies and services. You will play the role of a talent scout, tapping into various tools and resources to uncover the best talent in the market and matching them with the roles to which they are best aligned.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $113,000 - $121,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

description:
The Google Cloud Executive Recruiting team helps find, engage and hire leadership talent for our growing cloud business.

In this role, you will be working closely with VPs and Directors, recruiters, and HR partners as you map the market and engage with luminaries in the industry (primarily in the Networking, Data Centers, SRE, and Server Operations space). You will have an opportunity to contribute to the engagement and diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) strategy for our organization.

Our Executive Researchers are talent advisors to Google leaders of these functions and are relied on for advice about the outside talent market, as well as how it compares to the talented and accomplished Googlers we already have in the organization.

You will have a chance to present the external talent landscape and insights into Google’s business priorities, drive our Google Cloud Executive Recruiting search strategies and the engagement of truly transformative talent.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

title: Global Games Editorial Lead, Google Play
responsibilities:

  • Expertise in digital marketing or content/creative writing or video.

description:
Google Play provides the apps, games, and digital content services for Android devices. As a Global Games Editorial Lead, you will direct editorial efforts for the games vertical and help bring compelling editorial content to our users. You’ll hire and lead a team of content editors and develop the overall games editorial strategy by working closely with our cross-functional teams including Product, Design, Marketing, and Engineering. You will also help drive initiatives that create a coherent user experience across your team’s work by overseeing the creation of relevant and opinionated content, leading editorial experiments, and leveraging new product-driven features and capabilities to their best effect. You’ll support craft, drive quality, improve tools/processes, create efficiencies, and promote excellence.

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $169,000 - $181,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Google Cloud Migration Specialist, Professional Services
responsibilities:

  • Educate customers on the value proposition of Google Cloud, Google Cloud services, and explaining Google Cloud migration frameworks.   • Manage the current state assessments of the organization, technology capabilities, and technology environment including sizing, application dependencies, security requirements, and first mover workloads.
  • Guide future state optimization recommendations, cost over time, and return on investment (ROI) timeline.
  • Develop customer-validated future state organizational and technical architectures that include gap analysis, road-maps to the future state with a milestone driven time/phased execution plan.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 12 years of experience in the technology industry.
  • 5 years of experience in migrating workloads from on-premise or another public cloud to a public cloud platform (e.g., GCP, AWS, Azure etc.).
  • Experience in a customer-facing role representing customers and driving discussions with executives regarding trade-offs, practices, project management, and risk mitigation.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Information Science/Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, a similar field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Google Certified Professional Cloud Architect.
  • Experience with IT compliance and risk management requirements (e.g., security, privacy, SOX, HIPAA, etc.).
  • Experience implementing, designing, and building with cloud services.
  • Experience in the design, deployment, and operations in one or more areas of specializations (e.g., infrastructure, application, database migration, etc.).
  • Understanding of container management/scheduling tools (e.g., Kubernetes), infrastructure as code tools (e.g., Terraform, Ansible, etc.), and CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins, etc.).

description:
The Google Data Center Transformation(DCT) Cloud Specialist team collaborates across the GCP organization, liaising between product teams, service teams, partners, and customers to ensure the right transformation solutions are delivered to market with targeted feature innovation based upon customer needs.

As a Google DCT Cloud Migration Specialist, you will be at the forefront of making our top customers' future state vision a reality by leading them through their migration journey to Google Cloud Platform; from early vision casting and future state architecture through the first waves of application, infrastructure, and database migrations.

To do so, you will collaborate with Google’s delivery partners, customers, and business units directly on prioritized migration engagements, ensuring customer objectives are met. This role will develop a clear migration plan and journey during customer engagements. The plan’s goal will be to outline a path from consumption to ramp.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

description:
Our mission is to make Google Devices and Services inclusive and equitable experiences for everyone. We partner with teams across Google, industry partners, and local community organizations. As a Hardware Accessibility Program Management Lead, you will build the tools, metrics, and processes that help teams design, prototype, and test their product ideas to ensure that they work equally well for all our users. You will also focus on accessibility and inclusive hardware design processes to improve our accessibility, inclusion, and equity.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $174,000 - $187,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Head of Google Cloud Customer Experience, Services Marketing
responsibilities:
• Develop and execute a comprehensive marketing plan by showcasing an integrated services narrative inclusive of Professional Services, Customer Success, Support, and Learning teams in alignment with Google Cloud’s marketing strategy and business priorities.
  • Build close relationships with Customer Experience leadership, Marketing, Analyst Relations, and Public Relations teams to serve as a strategic business partner by proactively contributing marketing best practices and expertise.
  • Develop a customer evidence program for the portfolio of services for press, high-quality analysts, partnerships, and awards. Work closely with Marketing leaders to complement evidence programs in Google Cloud.
  • Partner with Marketing leaders to develop impactful digital marketing programs with stand-out messaging and tactics. Drive service capability-awareness and preference for Google Cloud service offers.
  • Manage and develop a team by working across time-zones and driving awareness and attachment of support offers.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or equivalent practical experience.
  • 15 years of experience in enterprise marketing strategy and planning, content development, and campaign execution.
  • Experience working in the professional services, support services, learning, and/or support organizations.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Knowledge of primary and secondary market research methodologies, including voice of customer tools.
  • Understanding of marketing channels and how to effectively leverage them in support of managed services and content.
  • Ability to present complex information to specific audiences and communicate across a variety of stakeholder groups including executives and technical subject matter experts.
  • Ability to lead through ambiguity with minimal guidance while bringing innovative and creative ideas to the forefront.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage/drive multiple customer experience service teams and content initiatives simultaneously.
  • Excellent analytical, critical thinking, storytelling, presentation, and writing skills.

title: Head of HR M&A Integration, Google Cloud
responsibilities:
• Apply M&A integration knowledge and experience to shape the overall Google Cloud HR M&A Integration strategy, operating model, tools, and templates.
  • Manage portfolio of all HR integration activities and workstreams related to acquisition by ensuring alignment with the Employee Experience Manager, M&A HR, and other partner teams.
  • Act as liaison and work cross-functionally with the M&A, People Partners, People Consultants, and People Development teams with acquired company leadership to drive integration efforts and ensure execution.
  • Work closely with the partner HR team to identify key areas requiring post-agreement integration support. Ensure geographical complexities are managed at a tactical level when providing training, communications, guidance, and support.
  • Identify and advise on any opportunities, risks, and trends related to the integration, and develop action plans to address.
qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 12 years of experience in consulting, M&A, HR, or business operations.

  • Experience with change management and with managing programs/practices.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience managing complex projects with multiple stakeholders across cross-functional teams.
  • Ability to manage strategy and execution.
  • Ability to influence at the executive level and progress initiatives while removing roadblocks without guidance.
  • Ability to use business judgment on sensitive, complex, and cross-functional issues, while fostering collaboration between leaders, teams, the larger organization, and related functions.
  • Ability to continuously improve work and identify operational efficiencies while meeting/exceeding client expectations.
  • Excellent problem-solving, analytical, presentation, and communication skills, attention to detail.

description:
As the Head of HR Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) Integration, you will help build, scale, and grow our Google Cloud HR M&A function. You will lead the Google Cloud People Operations team in acquisition diligence by focusing on the employee experience.

You will also help shape the overall integration strategy by working with our HR partners on execution of milestones integral to the successful onboarding, integration, and experience of employees. You will collaborate with Google Cloud People Partners, Google Cloud M&A Program Manager support, M&A HR, and more on pre- and post-business agreement integrations.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $213,000 - $229,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage various Engineering-specific programs and teams.

The Google Store is Google’s first-party physical retail store destination for hardware that is designed and made by Google (e.g. Pixel phones, Google Nest, Fitbit, and others). The Retail Operations team is responsible for launching new store locations, driving day-to-day business operations, creating and enhancing processes, and building tools that empower our in-store teams to deliver an exceptional experience to our customers.

As the Head of Program Management, you will drive effective planning and cross-functional execution of critical programs and initiatives. You will improve day-to-day project management activities and drive effective change management efforts.

You will manage, track, and report on the entire portfolio of cross-functional initiatives that are key to scaling Google’s first-party physical retail channel. Your cross-functional partners are in the Design, Retail Marketing, Store Systems, and Business Strategy teams.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $169,000 - $181,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Our Hiring Equity Leads sit within the broader Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) team in Global Recruiting, specifically the Hiring Equity Strategy and Programs team. This team leads and executes partnerships, strategies, and programs that enable the design, execution, and iteration of an equitable and inclusive hiring strategy across all lines of businesses across Google.

In this role, you will be reporting to the Director of Hiring Equity Strategy and Programs. You will be partnering to ensure staffers, leaders, and clients facilitate equity in Google’s hiring process, systems, and outcomes.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Salary range of $168,000 - $181,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Industry Solutions Architect, Consumer Packaged Goods, Google Cloud
responsibilities:
• Provide CPG and Retail domain expertise in supporting the technical relationship with Google’s customers.
  • Manage product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and enablement of integrations, allowing for a full deployment of products managing disparate datasets in Google Cloud.
  • Manage Go-to-Market (GTM) delivery and field readiness of solutions, and create packaged solution offerings to complement product offerings.
  • Work with customers to demonstrate and prototype product integrations in customer and partner environments, and recommend integration strategies, enterprise architectures, and platforms/application infrastructure.
  • Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events as needed.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience with distributed computing, software development, data analytics, cloud computing, virtualization, hosted services, storage systems, or content delivery.
  • Experience with PaaS, IaaS, SaaS, retail, CPG technologies, and IT.
  • Experience with programming languages and database technologies.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 10 years of experience in CPG with a focus in a Food/Agriculture manufacturer.
  • Experience architecting and developing software or infrastructure for scalable, distributed systems in CPG and retail environments.
  • Knowledge of data and information management.
  • Ability to communicate complex topics to executive stakeholders in business and IT.

description:
The Google Cloud team helps companies, schools, and government seamlessly make the switch to Google products and supports them along the way. You listen to the customer and swiftly problem-solve technical issues to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative, and innovative. You work closely with a cross-functional team of web developers and systems administrators, not to mention a variety of both regional and international customers. Your relationships with customers are crucial in helping Google grow its Cloud business and helping companies around the world innovate.

In this role, you will work with strategic Google Cloud Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) customers to build and scale repeatable industry solutions that differentiate Google and help transform the CPG industry.

You will focus on creating solutions which solve business challenges in the CPG industry by partnering with the Product teams on portfolio solution strategy and assist with implementations of Google Cloud CPG products and solutions with customers.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $184,000 - $198,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Industry Solutions Architect, Games, Google Cloud

  • Analyze, review, and modify solution architectures to increase operating efficiency and incorporate new requirements. Provide partners with specific tools and consultation to optimize partnership value.
  • Author and review technical documentation, including design, development, and revision documents. Write and review code in compiled or scripted languages.
  • Create applications using standard and Google-specific software development tools. Test, debug, maintain, and/or update applications.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Computer Science or other relevant technical field.
  • 5 years of experience as a Solution Manager or Developer, developing new solutions.
  • Experience with open source projects.
  • Experience with Machine Learning or Big Data.

description:
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As an Industry Solutions Architect for Games, you'll help set mission and strategy. You will meet with Game customers to facilitate business transformation and map success patterns. You’ll leverage your cloud computing expertise along with experience and deep technical knowledge of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence technologies, packaging together the full scope of Google Cloud horizontal and vertical specific products to create compelling solution offerings for our Game customers.

description:
The Google Cloud team helps companies, schools, and government seamlessly make the switch to Google products and supports them along the way. We problem-solve technical issues for customers to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative, and innovative. In this role, you'll work closely with a cross-functional team of web developers and systems administrators, and regional/international customers.

In this role, you will work with strategic Google Cloud Retail customers. You will support implementations of Google Cloud Retail products and solutions directly with customers, sharing best practices, providing guidance around architectures, data migration, capacity planning, and more.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) (Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $184,000 - $198,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado..
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Industry Solutions Manager, Google Cloud Manufacturing
responsibilities:
• Understand the cloud ecosystem, markets, and user requirements for manufacturing and industrial goals.
  • Launch solutions and features and test performance.
  • Partner with cross-functional teams on technologies.
  • Develop innovative solutions to problems by partnering across regions, product areas, and functions.
  • Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other events as needed.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 10 years of experience in a solutions or software development role.
  • Experience driving product direction, go-to-market strategy, design discussions, creating product roadmaps, and partnering with cross-functional teams.
  • Experience developing and launching products/technologies within cloud, SaaS, enterprise, or supply chain networks.
  • Experience with Customer360, B2B, business-to-customer, and Ecommerce for Manufacturing.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience managing daily technical and design direction.
  • Experience in cloud infrastructure, SaaS, big data, security/privacy, development/operations, artificial intelligence, or machine learning.
  • Experience with connected products with Customer360 and SAP solutions for Manufacturing customers
  • Knowledge of multiple functional areas (e.g., Product Management, Engineering, UX/UI, Customer Support, Finance, Marketing, etc.).
  • Ability to influence multiple stakeholders.

description:
Google Cloud helps many employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability, and scalability, from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware.

As an Industry Solutions Manager, you'll set the direction, mission, and strategy. You will collaborate with Google Cloud Manufacturing and Industrial customers to facilitate business transformation and map success patterns. You'll identify industry trends in cloud computing to recommend, plan, and address market opportunities with solutions. You'll leverage Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and analytics to develop solutions and create business value. You will ensure technical and commercial readiness for solutions. You will set goals and measurements for solutions adoption and recommendations for market implementation.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $170,000 - $183,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Technical writers communicate complex information clearly, concisely and accurately, and without relying on jargon. As a technical writer, your role involves tasks such as writing conceptual overviews and procedures, reading and writing example code, or updating help center queries and FAQs. Technical writers play a big part at Google. They are a key link between engineers, marketing associates, developer advocates, as well as all the external users and developers, tying together many vital but disparate parts of the Google ecosystem.

You develop complex, in-depth communications for internal and external audiences and manage projects that involve coordinating multiple junior writers.

As an Information Architect (IA), you'll be part of a cross-functional team responsible for delivering an excellent user experience for our documentation, code samples, and learning models.

In this role, you will help improve the user experience, information architecture, navigation, and reduce fragmentation and discoverability issues. You will work with our content strategists, technology leads, information architects, UX researcher, Cloud marketing, and platform teams.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Salary range of $132,000 - $142,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.
