title: Information Security Engineer
responsibilities:
• Perform technical security assessments, code audits, and design reviews.
  • Develop technical solutions to help mitigate security vulnerabilities.
  • Advocate security and secure practices throughout Google.
  • Conduct research to identify attack vectors against Google's products and services.
  • Be involved in security exercises.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of experience in application-level vulnerability testing and code-level security auditing.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.
  • Experience working in web application security.
  • Experience in software development using in C++ or Java.
  • Knowledge of security engineering, computer and network security, authentication, security protocols, and applied cryptography.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

description:
In this role, you will help ensure that our software and systems are designed and implemented to security standards. You will perform technical security assessments, code reviews, and vulnerability testing to highlight risk, helping Google teams and partners to improve security.

You will also work closely with other Google Engineers to design and build proactive methods to enhance our security. You will work on a wide variety of software designs and technology stacks. In addition, you will have the option to specialize or perform research in different fields.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) $120,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Our Security team works to create and maintain the safest operating environment for Google's users and developers. Security Engineers work with network equipment and actively monitor our systems for attacks and intrusions. In this role, you will also work with software engineers to proactively identify and fix security flaws and vulnerabilities.

As Google's products handle information at a large scale, we need to anticipate and protect against attackers targeting Google and our users.

As an Information Security Engineer, you can perform realistic offensive security exercises to simulate real attacks, to test and improve our detection and response capabilities, and to identify how attackers could infiltrate and move inside our infrastructure.

With your technical expertise, you will create scenarios that advanced attackers might use to compromise our security. You will emulate both the techniques used by known groups, and create new techniques that attackers might attempt in the future. After each exercise, you'll thoroughly document findings and present the results to partners and leadership.

You will work closely with teams to improve our detection capabilities, and other parts of security team and affected product teams to design defense-in-depth controls that limit attackers' ability to move inside our network.

At Google, our users come first, and the Systems Infrastructure team is at the heart of that promise. We build the technologies that transform the way we think about doing business. Whether working on our cloud systems, researching the latest in computer technology or keeping Google's internal systems humming, Googlers and users alike rely on us to keep things running. We're back-end experts: protecting your privacy and ensuring your security.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $142,000 - $153,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. .
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Product Security Assurance is the team within the Cloud Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) organization responsible for helping ensure every product Cloud ships is as secure as it can be and increasing the assurance levels of security in the infrastructure underlying all our products. This team also focuses on increasing the capabilities of each product team to develop more secure products by design and by default, from patterns, tools and frameworks to increasing the skill level of embedded security leads. As an Information Security Engineer you will help to ensure that our software and systems are designed and implemented to the highest security standards. You will perform technical security assessments, code reviews and vulnerability testing to highlight risk, helping Google teams and partners to improve security, and work on a wide variety of software designs and technology stacks.

Because we are new, you have the opportunity to help set the direction for product security in Google Cloud and partner with amazing existing teams across Google. These include existing security teams, privacy teams and engineering teams. Help set the focus, direction and impact of this organization with regards to product security. There is an exciting mix of work to be accomplished across multiple security domains, for example: security reviews, security education, web application scanning and testing, vulnerability research, and security data analysis, all with the goal of highlighting and driving down risk.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $198,000 - $212,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Job Architect, People Operations
responsibilities:
• Provide dedicated talent consulting support for multiple job roles within the architecture, and provide governance and oversight to job family structure creation, iterations, and maintenance.
  • List existing structure, use cases, processes, and systems involved, drive the change management, operational programs, and execution to deliver against a multi-year roadmap.
  • Analyze job family health data and perform an in-depth search to provide recommendations to functional area leadership to avoid proliferation.
  • Identify opportunities to develop actionable insights, and partner with business leadership to use Role Profiles to ensure robust talent management.
  • Be the point of contact and subject matter expert to functional area for job architecture questions and consultation, serve as the expert for job definition (e.g., demonstrating the ability to deeply understand the full range of issues, data sets, and dynamics at play).
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of experience in strategy, consulting, business operations, or Human Resources.
  • 3 years of experience performing job evaluation, benchmarking, compensation analysis, talent management, workforce planning, process design, competency modeling, and/or role scoping.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience executing strategic and operational initiatives working across cross-functional teams.
  • Ability to influence leaders through judgment and data.
  • Ability to manage complex data sets and do analysis (e.g., SQL, etc.).
  • Ability to take action, think analytically and systemically with an excellent attention to detail.
  • Ability to dissect problems, develop nascent ideas, and achieve results in a constrained environment.
  • Excellent communication, leadership, and project management skills.

description:
The Job Architecture team is part of ‘centers of expertise’ functions in people operations, which serves as the domain experts in People Operations delivering programs and expertise to Googlers.

In this role, you will take initiative to streamline Google’s job architecture in order to provide more consistency, improve workforce planning, and facilitate internal mobility for Googlers in every area of the organization.

As a Job Architect, you’ll provide talent consulting and management support for multiple job roles and architecture structures, and work closely with the business and Human Resources on change/client initiatives. You will identify opportunities to simplify and standardize operational processes, and partner with areas to drive scaled implementation.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $141,000 - $151,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.

In this role, you will define and lead Google Play’s App Quality strategy, including how apps and games are evaluated for quality, how quality impacts app discovery within Google Play, and how we work with developers to improve their app quality, across all Android form factors and ChromeOS.

You’ll achieve this by working with a core team of Google Play engineers with Product Manager team support, and other product and cross-functional teams.

Google Play offers music, movies, books, apps and games for devices, powered by the cloud. It syncs across devices and on the web. As part of the Android and Mobile team, Googlers working on Google Play do everything from engineering our backend systems, to shaping product strategy, to forming great content partnerships. They make it possible for people to do things like buy an ebook or song on their Android phone, then have it instantly available on their laptop. The Google Play team enhances the Android ecosystem by giving developers and partners a premium store where they can reach millions of users.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $219,000 - $236,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Lead Product Manager, Identity Platform
responsibilities:
• Ensure reliability of Google’s identity platform by working with engineers to set/execute on technical excellence projects to ensure our systems remain up and available as Google’s user base continues to grow rapidly.
  • Establish a multi-year goal for Google’s identity platform that looks ahead to consumer surfaces, ways of defining and managing digital identity, and higher global standards for privacy and security.
  • Set product strategy and roadmaps to achieve the goal while responding to the needs of your product partners and partner teams in Privacy, Safety, and Security.
  • Lead and mentor a Product Management team, design an organizational plan for providing appropriate levels of product managment support for an infrastructure-focused Engineering organization.
  • Collaborate across organizational boundaries and work across functions and Product teams, and help develop a platform direction to help achieve their goals.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 7 years of product management experience with technical products.
  • 3 years of experience in product management for platform products.
  • Experience as an product owner for systems with queries per second (QPS) and strict uptime requirements.
  • Experience with data-driven decision-making, roadmap/backlog management, and participation in multi-year planning.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with identity, user management, and/or security systems.
  • Experience effectively working with multiple functional areas, such as Product Management, Engineering, UX/UI, Sales, Customer Support, Finance, or Marketing.
  • Experience managing day-to-day technical and design direction.
  • Knowledge of cryptography.

description:
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

The Business process and Performance Team’s mission is to improve client, partner, and Googler experience through frictionless and automated end-to-end business processes (internal and external) that simplify the customer journey for Google Cloud’s market-leading technology.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

description:
Passionate people are everywhere at Google. In Developer Relations, we get excited to collaborate and connect with the communities that love technology as much as we do. Part community manager and part developer advocate, Developer Programs Engineers collaborate with developers at conferences and online, and advocate for developers interests internally at Google. Not afraid to be hands-on, you write sample code and client libraries as well as participate in developer forums and support queues to troubleshoot and debug coding problems developers encounter. Internally, you work with product engineering teams improve our products by conveying feedback from developers, reviewing API designs and testing new features. Chrome, Android, App Engine, HTML5 as well as our core Google Apps and Ads APIs are just some of the platforms you promote and support.

Drawing on your leadership and technical expertise, you drive how applications work across multiple platforms and industries as you grow our community of developers. You magnify the impact of Google's technology as you helps 3rd parties to work together.

Chrome's mission is to make the web work better for you. When we are successful, we help people achieve their goals and can use Chrome’s influence to make the open, indexable web better— helping Google achieve its overall mission. The team mission is to be a trusted partner to developers and enable them to build the best experiences possible on the web and with Chrome.

The Chrome Extension and Web Store team enables the Chrome Browser to stretch its capabilities to be a browser for everyone and create a platform for extension developers to be successful.

description:
As a Learning and Development (L&D) Data Strategist, you will help bring together learning and development content and experiences from across Google and around the world to help the development of Google employees and drive business imperatives. You’ll create business impact by driving efforts to ensure L&D data is universally useful, reliable, and accessible for our internal stakeholders and partners across Google. You will use analytics to solve day-today problems, build data and dashboard solutions to drive insights, and perform deep analysis to drive performance/strategy. You will also partner with the lead of the Google L&D Data Advisory Group to diagnose challenges, drive workstreams, and implement innovative data solutions that help Google thrive in human capability development.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $169,000 - $181,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
The People Development team works to strengthen Google’s performance and culture by preparing Googlers to navigate their challenges. We leverage expertise, engaging content, tools, technology, and innovative design to scale learning and support Googlers at all stages of their careers. In addition to learning programs, classes, and resources, we provide organizational development consulting and customized solutions that increase the health and performance of Google’s organizations and overall business.

In this role, you will be a part of a team responsible for working across the entire Learning and Development ecosystem to land the goal to bring together the learning and development content and experiences from across Google to accelerate the growth of Googlers and drive business imperatives.

You’ll partner with the leader of the Learning and Development Tech Advisory Group to create business impact by driving efforts to align Google Learning and Development on a technology stack and data infrastructure that results in a seamless, cohesive learning experience for all Googlers.

You’ll partner with technology leaders across Google Learning and Development to diagnose challenges, drive workstreams, and implement innovative solutions.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

title: Legal Investigations Support Risk Manager
responsibilities:
• Partner closely with subject matter experts across the team to complete a Risk and Control Self-Assessment (OCI’s RCSA) of LIS operations, identifying solutions to close the gap between current and aspirational risk postures, and managing remediation plans through to completion.
  • Work cross-functionally and with subject matter experts to define scalable frameworks, create templates, and support the team to ensure the team can operate smoothly through a variety of dynamic legal and operational issues.
  • Partner with Google’s central Compliance organization to complete periodic risk assessment exercises (e.g., Luminary, Controls Testing, Issues and Events) and key stakeholders to periodically review programs to improve internal processes to mitigate risk.
  • Develop reporting mechanisms to improve communications and transparency with our stakeholders, present reporting and analysis to executive management, and provide mentorship to team members within LIS.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience within a technology and/or legal field.
  • 5 years of experience in risk management and/or compliance.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in Consulting or Advisory.
  • Experience working with legal counsel and project management.
  • Experience managing multiple stakeholders and workstreams.
  • Experience in operations process design, execution, and best practices.
  • Understanding of risk assessments, control testing, and/or risk program development.
  • Excellent relationship skills.

description:
The Legal Investigations Support (LIS) team manages an operations and programs team of policy specialists who are at the forefront of international, criminal, and civil legal requests for user data. In this role, you will administer the processes and queues for these requests and manage vendors, working closely with counsel on sensitive matters. Alongside the LIS Operations teams, you will oversee strategic tooling, permissions, quality, and compliance initiatives. You will work with external teams, leadership, and counsel on a range of projects. You will also work across LIS to provide vision, set strategy and scalability plans for the team, measure and improve the timeliness and quality of the team’s service, and identify the need for new processes.

As the Legal Investigations Support Risk Manager, you will be the strategic mind building the infrastructure that makes it possible to incorporate “risk” into LIS’ decision-making processes, in our daily operations and in our long-term strategy, in a scalable way. You will have the judgment and mitigation mindset of a risk expert and act as the primary lead on risk management exercises (recurring and ad hoc audits, incident remediation, escalations) across the team. You will define the frameworks that guide the team in their daily operations and the decisions about where to utilize team resources. You will also take charge when it comes to resolving the business challenges which create the greatest compliance risk. You will create pathways through ambiguity, navigating compliance risk and operational swirl, to create clarity, transparency, and track-able data to advance the team’s overall strategy.

Additional Information(Colorado only*) Minimum Salary of $138,000 - $149,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
The Mergers and Acquisitions Technical Integrations team manages the technical integrations of companies into Alphabet and the deployment of systems and tools for Alphabet.

As a Mergers and Acquisitions Integration Lead, you will lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering knowledge. You will plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. You will also manage project schedules by identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You will also help develop and execute plans to integrate companies. You will partner with Product Area sponsors, functional leads in Engineering, Corporate Development, and Corporate Engineering to develop, define, and deploy scalable solutions that support Alphabet’s corporate development activities.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $216,000 - $232,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.

With Google Distributed Cloud Edge our goal is to create disruptive technologies and products in the context of edge computing, 5G, telco network intelligence, and modernizing telco network infrastructure. We build distributed edge cloud architecture, running as a fully managed hardware and software stack deployed across enterprises, telco data centers, and more. We leverage the best of Google's AI/ML and platform capabilities to power emerging ecosystems of low-latency workloads, including inference at the edge, cloud gaming, and photorealistic AR.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) $130,000 + bonus + equity + benefits
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

responsibilities:

  • Analyze the security of network systems from hardware to cloud services, and discover and address security issues.
  • Work with partner teams on company-wide security issues, strategies, and roadmaps.
  • Be the third tier escalation point for network security incidents.
  • Work with vendors, industry organizations, and internal teams on the development of new security capabilities.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 8 years of experience in a network security role in organizations with networks.
  • Experience building distributed security systems and available services.
  • Experience securing network protocol architectures and implementations.
  • Experience identifying and mitigating network security risks using threat modeling and other risk identification techniques.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 3 years of experience working with Python, C++, Java, or Go.
  • Experience with data protection technologies including encryption, key management, data loss prevention, and hardware security modules.
  • Experience developing and building Zero Trust networks and secure multi-cloud networks.

description:
Google is proud to boast a network that provides service to millions of Internet users around the world. The Network Engineering team is responsible for operating that network reliably and at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our systems running smoothly. You also ensure that network operations are safe and efficient by monitoring network performance, coordinating planned maintenance, adjusting hardware components and responding to network connectivity issues. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our users stay connected with our suite of applications, products and services.

Google Enterprise Networking (GEN) delivers an internal Enterprise network, providing global service to more than a quarter million users. The team is responsible for network reliability and scalability, keeping all Google employees connected and productive. We do that by creating designs, selecting hardware, and developing software toolchains. We are responsible for all Google offices, data centers, and specialty spaces. You will help solve a constant stream of challenges with continuous innovation, using an evolving set of technologies.

As a Network Engineer focused on security, you'll work on the enterprise infrastructure team defining security policies, performing security risk assessments, consulting on networking projects, managing security infrastructure, developing software for the automation of security tasks, and influencing industry. You'll solve large, strategic problems, transforming these complex problems into simple solutions. You'll make data-driven optimizations, and resolve complex operational issues in production via improvements to designs, software, and processes.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $180,000 - $194,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Partner Engineer, Chrome
responsibilities:
• Build broad technical expertise and practical experience with partners, Chrome OS, and Chrome browser products.
  • Drive technical ownership of key partnerships to ensure their solutions and applications are optimized on both Chrome OS and Chrome Browser. 
  • Engage with internal and external development teams to resolve technical issues and propose new features to enhance the integrations.

  • Influence our technology partners and provide feedback from the partner to Chrome Product and Engineering teams.
qualifications:

  • Experience working with web/internet related infrastructure technologies and architecture across SaaS, PaaS, IaaS, and cloud productivity suites.

  • Experience with coding in C, C++, Java, JavaScript, or Python.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Ability to quickly provide technical solutions to business problems.
  • Ability to influence at executive levels.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Passion for learning new technologies and creating partnerships.

title: Partner Manager, Energy Marketplaces
responsibilities:
• Develop, maintain and grow key relationships at both executive and working levels with accounts across our energy marketplace business and energy partners
  • Understand, prioritize and address a partner’s strategic goals, and promote their needs internally ensuring full cross-functional stakeholder awareness and understanding. 
  • Drive the business process to develop and drive high impact growth opportunities,  analyze partnership effectiveness and optimize growth, and drive thought leadership to create new opportunities to execute customer strategies for increasing business growth.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (marketing, sales, legal, sales operations, finance and more) with your team to develop and execute strategies
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
  • 3 years of professional experience in business development, sales, program management, partner management or similar fields.
  • Experience in e-commerce and the business needs of energy partners.
  • Ability to travel 50% of the time as required.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Knowledge and experience in developing growth strategies, particularly ecommerce
  • Knowledge of demand side management energy programs
  • Strong sales and commercial skills or deal-making experience, or business management experience; demonstrating autonomous leadership
  • Being able to connect market knowledge and channel experience to new opportunities
  • Ability to build quantitative and qualitative business cases, articulate trade offs, and confidently make data driven decisions and recommendations
  • Entrepreneurial, persistent, highly collaborative and curious with excellent interpersonal, communication, and analytical skills.

description:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

The Google Devices & Services team's mission is to build radically helpful experiences for users by combining the best of Google AI, Software and Hardware. The team was formed to bring the best of Google’s software and hardware to our users by bringing to market and distributing a Google-branded hardware portfolio. The team is responsible for managing all partnerships with retailers, energy providers, professional resellers and installation companies worldwide. This includes the partnerships for products such as Google Nest, Google Wifi, Chromecast and Google Home, Pixel and more.

As Partner Manager for the Industry Partnerships team you will report into the Head of Energy Marketplace Partnerships and be responsible for managing accounts in our energy marketplace partnerships business.

Your data-driven approach must demonstrate a deep understanding of energy industry markets as well as Google’s offerings. You will need to recognize opportunities to bring Google's innovations to new and legacy markets in unique ways, allowing Google to scale quickly and access consumers through our energy marketplace partners. You possess strong relationship-building skills to drive new partnerships and support the internal cross-functional teams needed to drive business.

Google’s Global Partnerships team powers extraordinary user experiences through partnerships that solve users’ needs, advance our partners’ goals, and further Google’s mission. Our team provides meaningful solutions — from helping publishers and developers grow their businesses through monetization solutions, to helping our long-term partners anticipate and navigate change in a way that delivers economic and reputational value. We build and distribute products through partnerships across a multitude of product areas, including Ads, Search & Assistant, Geo, Platforms & Ecosystems, Devices & Services, Health, Retail, Payments, Next Billion Users, and more. We collaborate across Google, ensuring a coordinated approach when engaging with our most complex and strategic partners.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $107,000 - $115,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

  • Ability to engage with leadership.

description:
The Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) Analytics team uses data to set, execute, and measure progress on Google’s diversity, equity, and inclusion goals.

You will set, drive, and track progress on Google’s diversity, equity, and inclusion goals with partners across People Operations and Google’s DEI team.

You will lead analytical projects advancing our goal of creating a more diverse, fair, accessible, and inclusive Google. You will work with many different types of HR data including demographic representation, attrition, promotion, and survey response data.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $100,000 - $108,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
The People Operations (POps) Central team provides services to enable and activate the People Operations organization.

As part of the POps Central organization, the Reporting and Analytics (R&A) team provides data and analytical needs for all teams within POps Central. The R&A team is responsible for providing reporting and delivering user insights to our partners. We connect dots and keep things moving across POps Central, aligning ideas, efforts, and energy to deliver high-quality service to Googlers, and drive organizational performance.

Our work impacts the decisions of POps leadership. We provide them with actionable insights, and empower them to make data-driven decisions. Our key priorities are to customize reporting solution for POps Central teams with all metrics and insights in one place, harmonize metrics reporting and taxonomy across all POps services, and provide analytical support to POps Central teams to solve critical business problems and drive improvements.

title: Planning Analyst, People Operations
responsibilities:

description:
As a Planning Analyst, you’ll be responsible for setting global hiring goals, developing models to build our global resource planning model, and creating growth forecasts that are used strategically across Staffing, Finance and Real Estate and Workplace Services. You’ll work in close partnership with the Staffing Management team and Corporate Finance to lead action-oriented analyses and provide regular weekly and monthly reports on performance and trends.

In this role, projects might include collaborating with Corporate Finance on growth models, using supply chain techniques to provide forward looking insight into our candidate pipeline, developing forecasts on Google's long-term growth, or developing resourcing models. Above all else, you’ll focus on ensuring that our staffing organization is well-informed and able to make thoughtful, data-driven decisions.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $122,000 - $131,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Policy and Business Operations Lead, Google Fi
responsibilities:
• Serve as the cross-functional lead and subject matter expert by driving product policy strategy and execution to enable sustainable subscriber growth and limit fraud/abuse exposure.
  • Analyze historical business trends and the future product roadmap to inform the development of policy strategy and the refinement of existing policies.
  • Drive the process design and implementation of product policies.
  • Oversee the execution of product policies to eliminate fraud and abuse risk, including coordination with the Google Fi cross-functional and vendor teams to ensure automation of execution processes.
  • Track and manage fraud and abuse financial impact.
qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
  • 5 years of experience in a consulting firm, internet company, consumer product company, and/or wireless company
  • Experience leading operations initiatives

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working with SQL
  • Ability to identify ambiguous problems and develop/implement effective solutions
  • Ability to lead the project lifecycle, drive/prioritize multiple initiatives, and work in a cross-functional, fast-paced environment
  • Excellent communication, analysis, and cross-functional stakeholder management skills
  • Excellent business acumen and problem-solving skills

description:
Google Fi is Google’s wireless service initiative that intelligently connects people to the best network available while enabling an excellent communication experience. Google Fi's mission is to drive innovation in the wireless industry so that people can get high-quality connectivity at a reasonable price.

As a Policy and Business Operations lead, you will develop and execute Google Fi’s product policy strategy to support Google Fi’s development. You will work closely with cross-functional teams and their leadership, including Product, Customer Support, Business Development, Finance, and Operations.

responsibilities:

description:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. As part of our recruiting team, you're charged with finding the most interesting candidates who bring an entrepreneurial spirit and a diversity of thought to all they do. You're responsible for guiding candidates through our hiring process and connecting them to the magic of working at Google. You are creative and driven, which allows you to develop lasting relationships with both candidates and hiring managers. You're also comfortable with numbers and drawing insights from analytics to make our hiring process smarter and more efficient.

Our Executive Recruiting team focuses on recruiting executive leaders for Google Cloud who are responsible for driving growth in a highly engaged market. Our work impacts the direction of the company. Our team aspires to provide a high-touch service to our internal clients with market and candidate insights.

In this role, you will work as a partner and advisor to fellow Googlers, hiring managers, and HR People Partners to define the skills, competencies, and experiences needed to enable Google’s success. You will work to bring people to those opportunities.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $213,000 - $229,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams in integrating future designs into manufacturing. Demonstrate process capabilities prior to releasing to production.  
  • Keep an overview of the state of art in nanostructure patterning. Set the goals for the future technological developments that support the NIL program roadmap. Secure the resources and collaborations needed to support these developments. Propose and write public funded projects to fuel longer term innovation.
  • Interact with New Technology Introduction (NTI) teams to support new growth programs from concept to launch. Work closely with Development Engineers to ensure manufacturable designs.
  • Drive the integration of nanostructure development in a semiconductor facility environment. Identify and seize new opportunities for the integration and improvement of the fabrication process.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Physics, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of experience working in new technology environment or 5 years of experience with an advanced degree.
  • 3 years of experience in technical leadership.
  • Experience with lithographic tooling and processing, including nano-imprint and fabrication of advanced optical devices.

Preferred qualifications:

  • PhD with postdoctoral study or 3 years of industrial experience in semiconductor or nanotechnology manufacturing.
  • Experience adapting existing processes with new physical building blocks or creation of new processes to fundamentally advance an existing field.
  • Experience with structured problems-solving and standard industrial risk assessments.
  • Experience fabricating and testing diffractive optical components.
  • Experience with nano-fabrication techniques, such as nano-imprint lithography, etch, deposition, and wets for semiconductor, photonic, or memory applications.
  • Experience with data analysis software (e.g., JMP, Python, etc.).

description:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

In this role, you will join a diverse group of experts tasked with building the foundations for immersive computing and building helpful user experiences. We're focused on making immersive computing accessible to billions of people through mobile devices.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $188,000 - $202,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Procurement Business Partner, Technical Infrastructure
responsibilities:

description:
The Procurement Business Partner role is within the Business Partnership team which is a core part of Google’s expanding Global Procurement Organization (GPO).

The Business Partnership team is designed to support, influence, and contribute to the overall strategic direction and operational performance of the organization. The core objective is value creation, which is not only cost reduction, but rather the entire procurement life cycle for the Product Area Region. This encompasses, but not limited to strategic alignment, demand definition and planning, innovation, capability building, risk mitigation and governance, improving market share, market and industry expertise, influencing efficiency and effectiveness, partnering on first-to-market strategies, Strategic Relationship Manager, and geo-political risk mitigation.

In this role, you'll help unlock value for Google to reinvest in what matters most. You'll bring velocity, efficiency, and security to buying at Google, while partnering across Google to deliver solutions fit for purpose. As a centralized organization operating in a complex environment, we bring union to stakeholders and suppliers to ensure the best outcomes. Our organization fosters a culture of collaboration and innovation while providing opportunities for ongoing career growth and development.

Additional Information (Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $166,000 - $178,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Product Analyst, Data Science
responsibilities:
• Conduct data analysis to make business recommendations (e.g. cost-benefit, invest-divest, forecasting, impact analysis).
  • Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders, creating visual displays of quantitative information.
  • Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to formulate and complete full cycle analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations.
  • Help Google to focus on key decisions to improve products and services.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of experience working with statistical packages (e.g. R, SAS, Stata, MATLAB, etc.).
  • Experience articulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL) and using statistics to arrive at an answer.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as; Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Sciences.
  • Experience in scripting with SQL, extracting large sets of data, and design of ETL flows.
  • Experience in an inter-disciplinary/cross-functional field.
  • Interest and aptitude in data, metrics, analysis and trends and applied knowledge of measurement, statistics and program evaluation.
  • Ability to translate analysis results into business recommendations, and excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Distinctive problem solving skills and impeccable business judgment.

description:
Product Analysts provide quantitative analysis, market expertise and a strategic perspective to our partners throughout the organization. As a data-loving member of the team, you'll serve as an analytics expert for your partners, using numbers to help them make better decisions. You will weave stories with meaningful insight from data. You'll make key recommendations for your fellow Googlers in Engineering and Product Management.

As a Product Analyst, you relish tallying up the numbers one minute and communicating your findings to a team leader the next. You can see different angles of a product or business opportunity, and you know how to connect the dots and interact with people in various roles and functions. You will work to effectively turn business questions into data analysis, and provide meaningful recommendations on strategy.

description:
Help serve Google's worldwide user base of more than a billion people. Business Analysts provide quantitative support, market understanding and a strategic perspective to our partners throughout the organization. As a data-loving member of the team, you serve as an analytics expert for your partners, using numbers to help them make better decisions. You weave stories with meaningful insight from data. You make critical recommendations for your fellow Googlers in Engineering and Product Management. As a self-starter, you relish tallying up the numbers one minute and communicating your findings to a team leader the next.

Leaders in Data Science can see different angles of a product or business opportunity, and you know how to connect the dots and interact with people in various roles and functions. You have substantial experience with analytical tools and techniques, and bring a solid skill-set in analyzing data and communicating recommendations. You will deepen your skill-set by working with analytical thought leaders across the company.

Data Scientists are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

Experimentation is at the core of what you do. In this role, you will work to effectively turn business questions into data analysis, and provide meaningful recommendations on strategy. This is a unique hybrid role that will focus on your knowledge of data infrastructure and your ability to drive insights.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

Additional Information(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $147,000 - $158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.

The Physical Security product team in Google Works has a mission to enhance safety at Google through technology that respects people and culture. We are a team of engineers, designers, product, and project managers working together with Alphabet's Global Security and Resilience Services (GSRS) organization to ensure our people and spaces are safe while preserving our open, collaborative, Googley culture.

A major area of focus in the Physical Security team is improving our approach to physical identity and access management in a way that empowers our security operations to enhance safety while respecting employees.

At Corp Eng, we build world-leading business solutions that scale a more helpful Google for everyone. As Google’s IT organization, we provide end-to-end solutions for organizations across Google. With an inclusive mindset, we deliver the right tools, platforms, and experiences for all Googlers as they create more helpful products and services for everyone. In the simplest terms, we are Google for Googlers.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $174,000 - $187,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
We are a company that helps you find answers to a company that helps you get things done. We want our products to work harder for our users in the context of their job, home, and life. They all share a single goal: to be helpful, so we can be there for our users big and small over the course of their day.

Ambient Computing Coherence is a critical area of investment to realize this business growth for all of Google Users by building a trustworthy platform that will make it easier for teams to deliver coherent Google User Journeys across a multitude of products, devices, and services.

This role drives the definition of ambient computing experiences and their delivery across Google product ecosystems. You will directly impact how people experience Google products, and our company mission is to make the world's information universally accessible in the most natural way possible for our customers using the computational products in their world. You will work closely with multiple product teams across the company and take on challenges to drive clarity on both end-to-end user experiences and critical platform components. You will represent Google's ecosystem users as we make their entire world more helpful, trustworthy, and intelligent.

description:
As a Product Manager, you will help to ensure user privacy on Android applications by understanding and preventing privacy abuse caused by ads within the Android and Google Play ecosystem. You will help to shape the future of Android user privacy by restricting access to device and user identifiers, evaluating and driving how apps and Software Developer Kits (SDKs) communicate with each other and browser/web-view objects.

You will also help prevent ad fraud on the Google Play and Android ecosystems by influencing policies. You will work with Engineering to detect and block ad fraud and maintain overall responsibility for the metrics and performance of the Android and Google Play ecosystem.

Android is Google’s open-source mobile operating system powering more than 3 billion devices worldwide. Android is about bringing computing to everyone in the world. We believe computing is a super power for good, enabling access to information, economic opportunity, productivity, connectivity between friends and family and more. We think everyone in the world should have access to the best computing has to offer. We provide the platform for original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and developers to build compelling computing devices (smartphones, tablets, TVs, wearables, etc) that run the best apps/services for everyone in the world.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Salary range of $147,000 - $158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.

The Product Management team for Core Developer Web partners with Engineering and other cross-functional teams to drive the product strategy for Google’s web developer platform, helping every Product team at Google achieve higher velocity, greater quality, and more robust services, as well as leveraging the platform to transform the way web apps are built.

We work with all Google product areas as our customers, understanding the strategic needs of those product areas and their consumer markets, and building on that understanding to create a forward-looking web development platform that removes friction and makes it easy to harness the power of Google’s platforms, data, and AI to create the next generation of compelling products.

The Core team builds the technical foundation behind Google’s flagship products. We are owners and advocates for the underlying design elements, developer platforms, product components, and infrastructure at Google. These are the essential building blocks for excellent, safe, and coherent experiences for our users and drive the pace of innovation for every developer. We look across Google’s products to build central solutions, break down technical barriers and strengthen existing systems. As the Core team, we have a mandate and a unique opportunity to impact important technical decisions across the company.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $147,000 - $158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. As a Product Manager for the Chrome Browser Trust and Safety team, you will manage product launches across several Chrome Security teams (e.g., gathering requirements, defining features, communicating with stakeholders, and managing launch processes and outreach).

  • Experience with user interface (UI) design principles or user research

At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.

description:
Our mission is to help millions of developers worldwide create the highest-quality and most trustworthy experiences that delight users.

In partnership with Google’s product areas, we deliver integrated, easy-to-use, and extensible developer tools with built-in AI assistance that enable the most secure software supply chain. Our teams help developers grow their skills, reputations, and careers through our commitments to open source, engagement in developer communities, and comprehensive education, mentoring, and support.

Our team is an agile product group focused on third-party app developers. Entrepreneurial spirit is deeply rooted within the team. Our customer base span from early-stage startups to top apps globally.

You are interested in working with with customers, startup communities, and traveling to meet developers worldwide.

description:
At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.

In this role, you will work with Engineering and UX teams to develop both fleet services and developer products to enable partners to build quickly on the Google platform. You'll build scale-able tools so that first-to-market innovations can later be scaled to multiple partners. You will work with Business Development teams to take product innovations to partners in order to drive integrations and business growth. You'll work with Nest Solution teams to help create product integrations that open distribution channels.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $147,000 - $158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Fuchsia is an open source operating system created at Google that is currently under active development. We are building Fuchsia from the kernel up to meet the needs of today’s growing ecosystem of connected devices.

As a Product Manager, you will define and grow the Fuchsia developer experience across tools, services, code, and platform. Some of the focus areas include debugging, profiling, forensics, tracing, and actionable insights. You will engage on platform capabilities, Application Programming Interface (APIs), developer workflows, custom tools (i.e., command line and graphical), and integrations with industry standards/tooling.

In this role, you will create/drive strategies to engage with and partner with kernel, platform, tools, UX, and users on the development/delivery of Fuchsia's code insights capabilities and tools.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) $124,000 + bonus + equity + benefits

description:
Fuchsia is an open source operating system created at Google that is currently under active development. We are building Fuchsia from the kernel up to meet the needs of today’s growing ecosystem of connected devices.

Fuchsia is still evolving rapidly, but the underlying principles and values of the system have remained relatively constant throughout the project. The core principles guiding Fuchsia’s design and development are to be: simple, secure, updatable and performant.

As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for defining and driving a comprehensive strategy for benchmarking, measuring, and holistically improving quality across areas like speed, power consumption, memory usage, and input latency. You will work cross-functionally, leverage data-driven product management, and drive metrics driven decision making. This work is key to scaling a novel operating system while ensuring and improving quality for users and devices.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $124,000 - $133,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.

Google Fi is Google’s mobile service with a mission to ensure that everyone can get connected anywhere and anytime in a way that’s easy, safe, and private. We work to re-envision how mobile operators should work by making connectivity simple and available.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $147,000 - $158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Product Manager, Search Social Impact
responsibilities:
• Drive the creation and adoption of high-quality technologies focused on sensitive and societal user needs.
  • Contribute to making high-quality structured information easily accessible to global Search and Assistant users.
  • Explore user journeys, identify gaps in information needs, and build solutions that enable informed/sustainable decisions.
  • Conceive, define, and drive the research/product requirements to build great experiences for users.
  • Partner with Engineering, UX, Program Management, Partnerships, Public Policy, PR, Legal, and Marketing to build and deliver crafted consumer features.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience in product management with technical products.
  • Experience working with cross-functional teams (e.g., Engineering, User Experience/User Interface, Program Management, etc.).
  • Experience with the product development lifecycle (e.g., product roadmap, Go-To-Market strategy, product launch, etc.).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience launching products within the healthcare, government, non-profit, or environmental domains.
  • Experience with consumer-facing products with a high social impact.
  • Experience designing and launching products.
  • Ability to influence multiple stakeholders.

description:
The Search Social Impact (SSI) team connects users with information in areas like civics, jobs, economic security, and sustainability. SSI manages the product experience across our Search and Assistant platforms, and is responsible for helping users find the information they need to make important life decisions or complete tasks.

As a Product Manager, you will work cross-functionally to guide products and connect the technical and business worlds. You will break down complex problems into steps that drive product development. Our team works closely with engineers, designers, marketers, and other teams to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information.

Google aims to build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. As a Product Manager at Google, you could be working on new technologies, platforms, consumer facing products, and/or enterprise systems. The end goal will be to match you with the team that best aligns with your interests, experience, and where you will have the most impact.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $124,000 - $133,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Product Manager, Smart Home, Google Nest
responsibilities:
• Define and prioritize requirements for third-party platform features, informed by internal and external teams.
  • Drive the product execution, working closely with Engineering, Program Management, Business Development, Marketing, UX and partner teams to land excellent smart home experiences for users.
  • Identify evolving technology trends in the home and enable Google to build products and services for the smart home space.
  • Work with the analytics team to implement a data-driven framework for understanding and improving our third-party user experiences.
  • Coordinate and align cross-functional teams.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience in full lifecycle product management.
  • Experience driving elements of the product development lifecycle (e.g., product roadmap, go-to-market strategy, driving requirements, product launch, etc.).

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field.
  • Experience working with smart home devices.
  • Experience working with multiple functional areas such as Product Management, Engineering, UX/UI, Sales, Customer Support, Finance, or Marketing.
  • Ability to influence multiple stakeholders without direct authority.

title: Product Manager, Smart Home, Google Nest
responsibilities:
• Define Smart Home platform features, informed by research and data on emerging technology trends in the home, and enable Google to build products and services that leverage our Identity framework.
  • Drive the product execution, working closely with engineering, program management, UX and partner teams to land the best experience for our users.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams from Google Nest, Google Assistant, Android, and more to define the Identity platform goals and how we achieve them.
  • Work with the analytics team to implement a data driven framework for understanding and improving our user experiences.
  • Work with Google Nest teams to define Smart Home requirements. Translate those requirements into scalable product solutions that work well as systems across multiple surfaces and verticals.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of product management experience with technical products.
  • Experience driving elements of the product development lifecycle such as product vision, go-to-market strategy, driving requirements, and product launch.
  • Experience working with cross-functional (e.g. engineering, UX/UI, Program Management, etc.) teams.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Familiarity with existing technologies and industry practices around connected home technology.
  • Experience working on infrastructure related products or services.
  • Excellent consumer product design instincts.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a good ability to describe complex concepts in simple terms.
  • Ability to engage with senior stakeholders to achieve consensus on complex decisions.
