description:
At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.

The Google Nest team is looking for an outstanding Product Manager who is excited to build a proactive home that runs itself, helping users be more comfortable, safe, and efficient everyday. To achieve this vision, we established the Smart Home team to make the smart home about people and not only devices by providing contextual and personalized experiences for everyone in the home in a private manner.

As a Smart Home Product Manager, you will drive both strategy and development for short-term and long-term investments in foundational platforms. You'll work with multiple cross-functional teams including smart speakers, smart displays, cameras, thermostats, and doorbells, and be especially involved in collaborations with Google Assistant and Android teams.

The Google Nest team focuses on hardware, software and services offerings for the home, ranging from Nest thermostats to Nest smart displays. The Nest team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make users’ homes more helpful. Our mission is the helpful home: to create a home that cares for the people inside it and the world around it.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) $124,000 + bonus + equity + benefits
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

Google’s Technical Infrastructure (TI) organization builds, operates, and maintains the infrastructure that makes Google possible. Within TI, the Systems Infrastructure team builds the hardware and software delivering the compute, storage, and networking infrastructure for our customers.

description:
Google’s Threat Analysis Group (TAG) tracks, analyzes and counters threat actors involved in disinformation campaigns, government-backed hacking, and financially motivated abuse. The team produces intelligence for Google's product and security teams and Google Management while maintaining our own threat intel platform, malware analysis tooling, and support.

As a diverse team of Security Experts, Analysts, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to keep Google and our users safe from serious threats across the full range of products, as well as the Internet as a whole.

In this role, you will be responsible for charting the course of how we expand the capabilities of our analysis systems, which are currently integrated with Google products such as Gmail, Android, and YouTube. TAG also works closely with multiple cross-functional teams within Google that use the information we provide to detect Google adversaries on our platforms.

The Core team builds the technical foundation behind Google’s flagship products. We are owners and advocates for the underlying design elements, developer platforms, product components, and infrastructure at Google. These are the essential building blocks for excellent, safe, and coherent experiences for our users and drive the pace of innovation for every developer. We look across Google’s products to build central solutions, break down technical barriers and strengthen existing systems. As the Core team, we have a mandate and a unique opportunity to impact important technical decisions across the company.

Additional Information
Minimum salary range between $147,000 - $158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

description:
At Google, we put our users first. The world is always changing so we need Product Managers who are continuously adapting and excited to work on products that affect millions of people every day.

In this role, you will work cross-functionally to guide products from conception to launch by connecting the technical and business worlds. You can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at Google speed.

One of the many reasons Google consistently brings innovative, world-changing products to market is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative and prolific engineers, designers, marketers, etc. to help design and develop technologies that improve access to the world's information. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users.

Google One is a consumer subscription product offering a premium Google experience anchored on storage for products like Gmail, Drive, and Photos and emphasizing additional peace of mind features like device backup and Virtual Private Network (VPN). Our long-term goal is to create an up-leveled version of Google products, by offering even more help and protection.

Your primary mission is to make VPN a successful anchor for Google One subscribers. You will achieve this with a combination of tactics such as launching in more countries and clients, ensuring there’s an optimal onboarding experience, promoting the product to non-members, and developing attractive features that continue to address user pain points.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.

title: Product Marketing Lead, Google Distributed Cloud
responsibilities:
• Build inspiring messaging and content that excites customers.
  • Partner with Product, Partnership, and Marketing teams to drive awareness and adoption of net customers for Google Distributed Cloud.
  • Build and optimize acquisition programs based on user insights with a focus on experimentation and continuous improvement. Comfortable synthesizing qualitative and quantitative insights to inform program design and optimization.
  • Lead and inform partnership programs in close collaboration with Partner Marketing, Business Development, and Product Management to create an ecosystem of independent software vendor (ISV) partners to transform industries with Edge computing.
  • Manage objective and key results including sourced pipeline, Qualified Sales Opportunity (QSO), business, web/blog page views, and free trials.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in a technical, marketing field, or equivalent practical experience
  • 10 years of experience in enterprise technology or software marketing
  • Experience building creative assets and marketing content for customer acquisition programs
  • Experience working collaboratively across multiple teams (e.g., Engineering, Developer Relations, and Marketing)

description:
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the representation of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

In this role, you are responsible for driving Product Marketing for our Google Distributed Cloud, with a focus on net customer acquisition.

You will drive internal and external communications representing the Google Distributed Cloud marketing strategy, investment, and adoption progress.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.

description:
The Business Planning and Commercialization team owns Strategic Packaging and Pricing for all of Google Cloud, including Google Cloud Platform and Google Workplace. We drive strategic cross-product and cross-functional initiatives for Google Cloud leadership to continuously improve Google Cloud strategy, policies, processes and operationalization to deliver structure for all existing and new products, solutions, programs. We support all Google Cloud products, solutions, agreement structures, programs (product-specific or cross-product), and relevant systems.

In this role, you will have the responsibility to determine and set how Google Cloud makes profit, at the level of individual products and across the entire Google Cloud portfolio. You will partner with Product of a large part of Google Cloud's business and guide the Packaging, Pricing architecture, and Pricing of all Google Cloud products in that portfolio. You will guide the executive leaders of the portfolio to make decisions around product growth and pricing strategy. You will provide thought partnership to Product Managers on their approach. You will pressure test pricing proposals to ensure pricing structure consistency, value pricing, and implementability.

You will also support a range of cross-Google Cloud strategic initiatives that address key challenges and opportunities as identified proactively by the Business Planning and Commercialization team or the executive leadership. By acting as a strategic advisor and consultant, you will guide executive leaders across multiple functions (Product, Sales, Operations, etc) on diagnosing the situation, identifying and selecting recommendations, and developing a plan to implement solutions.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $147,000 - $158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Product Operations and Strategy, Google Cloud Market Insights
responsibilities:
• Develop deep insights into the cloud infrastructure market landscape to understand business performance metrics, cost and business growth drivers, financial metrics, and operational goals.
  • Understand market insights, benchmarks, and commercial/operational efficiency based on available financial data in the market.
  • Lead creation, development, and implementation of a consistent set of financial, operational, and business performance metrics for Google Cloud Platform.
  • Engage directly with Google Cloud leadership on market insights, and provide actionable recommendations on strategic initiatives to capture opportunities.
  • Drive a range of cross-Google Cloud strategic initiatives based on proactively-identified opportunities as well as Google Cloud leadership needs.
qualifications:

description:
The Google Cloud Market Insights team drives cross-platform and cross-functional Strategic Initiatives and Insights for all of Google Cloud, including Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Google Workplace.

We develop insights into the cloud infrastructure market from a customer and vendor perspective, covering topics across business performance, product offerings, financial metrics, and operational goals. We also drive and collaborate on key strategic initiatives defined by Google Cloud leadership.

We partner with teams Google Cloud, with a goal to provide insights that consider the whole of our business rather than a specific product or function.

In this role, you will help ensure Google Cloud is setting the correct operational and financial goals for all aspects of the Google Cloud business. You will partner with product, finance, technical infrastructure, and go-to-market (GTM) functions to set insightful goals for their business performance based on market benchmarks. You will provide thought partnership and guide executives leaders in business based on market dynamics.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $147,000 - $158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Product Quality Engineer, Google Cloud
responsibilities:
• Lead Quality Engineering for multiple compute products, from qualification through large-scale deployment, that involve new technologies or new uses of multiple existing technologies
  • Provide technical leadership, set priorities, and drive resolution of complex technical issues for a robust product quality and predictable field deployment
  • Analyze manufacturing and field data to extract actionable insights and areas of opportunity for continuous improvement
  • Initiate, drive, and implement innovative products, processes, and tools development/improvement projects, separately and in a cross-functional environment
  • Monitor, review, and present product performance data and metrics to stakeholders in a concise and clear way that enables data-driven decision-making
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, other related engineering field, or equivalent practical experience
  • Certified Reliability Engineer (CRE) and/or Certified Quality Engineer (CQE) certification
  • 7 years of experience in quality of computing hardware with engineering issue resolution
  • Experience in data analysis and visualization using tools such as JMP, Python, SQL, or equivalent

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree or PhD in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, related engineering field
  • 10 years of experience in Quality Engineering of cloud technology or complex hardware systems
  • Experience leading cross-functional engineering teams using a practical and solution-oriented approach
  • Experience with advanced Design for Quality and/or Design for Reliability for cloud computing systems
  • Experience with advanced statistical (or statistics based) methodologies such as design of experiments, statistical process controls, Six Sigma, etc.
  • Experience in technical leadership, project management, and executive communication with excellent de-escalation skills

description:
As a Product Quality Engineer, you will lead product related activities between engineering teams and suppliers. This includes identifying and managing risks and communicating project goals to stakeholders.

In this role, you will evaluate the product designs and create the processes, tools, and procedures to help continuously improve our products and manufacturing process. You will work closely with various highly skilled design and manufacturing engineering teams, product operations, and supply chain teams to ensure the product represents the very best of Google's brand and ensures a quality of service beyond today’s standards.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $118,000 - $127,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

title: Program Manager, Demand and Supply Planning, Pixel
responsibilities:
• Develop short and long-range supply and demand models that seek to minimize total costs and inventories while maintaining excellent service levels to partners and customers worldwide.
  • Present supply and demand recommendations to leadership, drive timely decisions, and ensure clear and concise communication to all stakeholders in the supply chain.
  • Collaborate with demand planning, sales operations, and product management teams to comprehend and influence demand assumptions, scenarios, inputs, and adjustments to consensus forecasts.
  • Drive product success by keeping ourselves and others accountable for metrics such as inventory, excess and obsolescence, material spend, sales in and sales through, freight in, cost of goods sold, and gross margins.
  • Drive product strategy via analytics, propose optimal launch dates, capacity investments, stock keeping units, feature portfolio, cost-reduction opportunities, and supply strategies to maximize supply chain flexibility and maximize business growth.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in program management.
  • 5 years of experience in supply chain management/operations experience in consumer hardware.
  • Experience in demand planning and/or forecasting.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working in a program management environment with requirements, priorities, and shared resources.
  • Experience developing data-driven insights and presenting recommendations in a supply chain management consulting setting.
  • Experience driving supply chain strategies at scale.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to discern key inputs and retain and use data that drives impact decisions with analytical skills.

description:
A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Program Manager at Google, you’ll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish — working with stakeholders to plan requirements, manage project schedules, identify risks, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. Your projects will often span offices, time zones, and hemispheres. It's your job to coordinate the players and keep them up to date on progress and deadlines.

Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.

In this role, you will help expand and enhance our global supply and demand planning operations. You will sit within Google’s Consumer Hardware team and will be responsible for supply and demand planning activities long-term Pixel new product introduction (NPI) programs. You will manage key internal and external stakeholders as they oversee supply chain operations for Google’s hardware business. You will also be key in defining our NPI strategy (e.g., launch, portfolio, assortment, cost, etc.).

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $98,000 - $106,000 + bonus + equity + benefits..

description:
A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you’ll use your technical expertise to lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish. You’ll work with stakeholders to plan requirements, identify risks, manage project schedules, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. You're equally comfortable explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical tradeoffs in product development with engineers.

Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.

Our team's mission is to drive partner success by making it easier and more valuable for developers to build high quality and responsible apps across devices.

We focus on understanding the problems that developers face when building for Android. We advocate for developers by advocating quality, creating helpful content and resources, and influencing Android Product and Engineering teams to build products that solve developer problems.

In this role, you will help the team get and remain organized. You will keep the tasks running on time for all team operations, across initiatives and programs. You'll help define objectives, measure success, communicate progress, identify, and mitigate risks.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $118,000 - $127,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. Whether you are making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you have an eye on the staffing needs of Google and the broader hiring landscape. You are focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for Google's long-term hiring needs, and work across a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams. You are both scrappy and resourceful, creative and driven -- and excited to share the magic of working at Google.

As the DEI (Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion) Program Manager, you and your team will enable the design, execution, and iteration of an equitable and inclusive hiring strategy across all Product Area verticals within Google. In this role, you will sit under the leadership of a Vertical DEI Program Manager Lead, and partners to ensure staffers, leaders, and clients adopt focused skills and hiring systems.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum Salary of $116,000 - $125,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.v*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
At Google, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users.

In this role, you will manage our products through development and launch. You’ll coordinate many changing, moving parts, represent users by advocating for them, and drive key bugs to closure with our Product teams.

You’ll also be responsible for organization process improvements, helping to streamline and scale our programs. You are responsible for identifying and managing risks, making sound judgments about product quality, and stopping (or speeding up) schedules at the right time.

The Google Nest team focuses on hardware, software, and services for the home, ranging from Nest thermostats to Nest smart displays. The Google Nest team develops, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make users’ homes more helpful. Our mission is the helpful home: to create a home that cares for the people inside it and the world around it.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $118,000 - $127,000 + bonus + equity + benefits..
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
The Recruiting Enablement team enables Google to find and hire the best talent everywhere. Our department includes operations management, resource management, analysis and insights, hiring process design and technology, and special projects. Our team sets the strategy for and leads broad-reaching change efforts. We ensure recruiters and key stakeholders are engaged, informed, and prepared to receive and embed people, process, and technology changes.

The Recruiting and Hiring Learning and Development team enables Google Recruiting to achieve its business goals by delivering effective learning and development programs. For Recruiting Googlers, we support their career journeys with onboarding, process and technology training, manager development, and skill building. For all Googlers, we ensure they have the knowledge and skills needed to effectively engage in the hiring process.

As the Program Manager in Operations and Measurement for Learning And Development, supporting Recruiting Enablement, you’ll be part of a team that utilizes our People and Learning data and builds tools and infrastructure to support learning programs that reach partners across the recruiting organization and Google.

In this role, you will create and manage an operational excellence program by building and maintaining dashboards and technical solutions to drive insights and automation, performing analysis to drive learning performance and strategy, and using analytics to solve day to day problems.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $116,000 - $125,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Program Manager, Privacy Governance and Compliance, Google Cloud
responsibilities:
• Manage and deliver programs to ensure that Google Cloud is compliant with privacy laws and regulations.
  • Drive impact assessment on privacy frameworks impacting Google Cloud.
  • Drive communication strategy, including the creation of privacy content, for use with the public, regulators, and customers.
  • Work closely with Engineering, Marketing, Legal, PR, Public Policy, and other team members to drive privacy programs.
  • Utilize project reporting tools to track planning, scheduling, issues, risks, and the overall status of privacy programs.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Law, Policy, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience in program or project management.
  • Experience working with global privacy laws, regulations, and binding privacy commitments.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master of Laws (LLM).
  • Certified Data Privacy Professional (CDPP).
  • Certification from International Association of Privacy Professionals (e.g., CIPP, CIPM, CIPT).
  • Experience in compliance and risk management.
  • Understanding of large-scale privacy challenges, requirements, policies, standards, and implementation strategies.

title: Program Manager, Sustainability Reporting
responsibilities:
• Contribute to ongoing evolution and implementation of global sustainability reporting and disclosure strategy
  • Manage preparation of annual corporate sustainability reports, including Environmental Report, CDP Response, EU Non-financial Reporting Directive (EU NFRD) Report, and Sustainability Bond Impact Report
  • Partner with cross-functional, internal stakeholders across Google to execute key sustainability reporting activities, such as drafting, reviewing, and due diligence
  • Improve alignment of our public sustainability narrative, metrics, and claims across key channels
  • Lead engagements with external consultants and other partners to support key workstreams
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of relevant experience in sustainability or project management.
  • Experience with sustainability reporting and related frameworks (e.g., CDP, Task Force on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) and Global Reporting Initiative (GRI)).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master’s degree
  • Experience leading development and implementation of sustainability reporting, strategy, and/or projects in a large organization
  • Knowledge of topics and trends related to sustainability reporting and corporate sustainability strategy, including key environmental challenges and solutions (e.g., climate change, clean energy, carbon foot-printing, water, and circular economy)
  • Knowledge of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) ratings/rankings (e.g., Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI), MSCI, and Sustainalytics)
  • Ability to drive projects from idea through to implementation, including identifying and implementing process improvements
  • Excellent project management skills

description:
A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you’ll use your technical expertise to lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish. You’ll work with stakeholders to plan requirements, identify risks, manage project schedules, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. You're equally comfortable explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical tradeoffs in product development with engineers.

Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.

In this role, you will work with the entire cross-functional team including internal and external Legal Counsel, Compliance, Privacy, Security, Technical Infrastructure teams, and other Product teams at Google in addition to the Fitbit product teams. You will be responsible for ensuring we manage these commitments through the full product development lifecycle. You will be part of the Wear OS Program Management team but will work closely with Wear OS cross-functional leadership.

Making the world's information universally accessible and useful doesn't stop at the desktop. The Mobile team builds tools to get you the information you need no matter where you are. Android has become the world's most popular mobile ecosystem, powering billions of devices, from smartphones to tablets, watches to TVs and everything in between. Whether adding to the core Android experience, forging new markets for digital content, creating immersive and portable versions of our products or managing relationships with a global community of developers, the Mobile team is giving you Google on the go.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $142,000 - $152,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Program Manager at Google, you’ll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish — working with stakeholders to plan requirements, manage project schedules, identify risks, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. Your projects will often span offices, time zones, and hemispheres. It's your job to coordinate the players and keep them up to date on progress and deadlines.

Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.

People Operations (POps) Works is responsible for building the systems used to hire, grow, and retain Google's talent. We partner with POps to create solutions to achieve this, using first- and third-party solutions.

In this role, you will partner with Product Managers, Business Systems Analysts, Engineering, and POps stakeholders to inform our direction and roadmap. As Google continues to grow, you will be instrumental to enabling scale.

At Corp Eng, we build world-leading business solutions that scale a more helpful Google for everyone. As Google’s IT organization, we provide end-to-end solutions for organizations across Google. With an inclusive mindset, we deliver the right tools, platforms, and experiences for all Googlers as they create more helpful products and services for everyone. In the simplest terms, we are Google for Googlers.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $118,000 - $127,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

description:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. As part of our exceptional recruiting team, you're charged with finding the most interesting candidates who bring an entrepreneurial spirit, a sense of resourcefulness and a diversity of thought to all they do. You're responsible for guiding candidates through our hiring process and connecting them to the magic of working at Google. You are creative and driven, with an interpersonal savvy that allows you to develop lasting relationships with both candidates and hiring managers. You're also comfortable with numbers and drawing insights from analytics to make our hiring process smarter and more efficient.

You work closely with the executive management team to develop recruiting strategies. You prioritize team resources and manage performance metrics to achieve hiring targets and optimize client and candidate experience.

In this role, you will be responsible for hiring, building, developing and providing leadership across the recruiting team. You’ll be tasked with leading a team of recruiters to deliver on hiring and pipeline representation goals. You will partner with executive staffing leaders across Product Areas to build strategies, execute on plans, and effectively communicate progress against clients hiring objectives. You will focus on developing the recruiting team, partnering with other staffing leads to execute against goals, and implementing team and cross-functional process changes to optimize recruiting efficiency.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $168,000 - $181,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Google’s Threat Analysis Group (TAG) tracks threat actors involved in disinformation campaigns, government backed hacking, and financially motivated abuse. The team produces intelligence for Google's product and security teams and Google Management, while maintaining our own threat intel platform, malware analysis tooling, and support.

On this team, you will work with Detection and Response and Trust and Safety teams to provide intelligence that drives detection of Google adversaries and disinformation on our platforms. You will produce and disseminate TAG's Intel across multiple cross-functional teams.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $117,000 - $126,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Research Manager, Consumer Executive Search, Google Cloud
responsibilities:
• Manage, develop, and coach the Consumer Leadership Staffing Research team (i.e. strategy, operations, and communications) roles to ensure excellent search execution and talent engagement skills.
  • Leverage strategic thinking, influencing, and coaching skills in order to lead a successful team and help hire exceptional talent.
  • Partner with executive-level management on high-profile leadership requisitions and assist them in determining and fulfilling their talent needs.
  • Create and execute leadership search strategies across a variety of technology leadership roles for the consumer technology teams.
  • Identify, evaluate, and present leadership talent to executive management, providing a point-of-view on the talent and market landscape.
qualifications:

Preferred qualifications:

  • Ability to stay up-to-date on new markets and to run a thorough search process, including leadership candidate research, outreach, engagement, evaluation, and presentation.
  • Executive presence and excellent consultative skills.

description:
Google is known for our innovative technologies, products and services — and for the people behind them. The Google Recruiting team focuses on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers. You will lead and motivate a team of direct reports to achieve amazing performance goals. You'll work closely with the executive management team to set and develop business strategies. You will draw insights from analytics to make our people process smarter and more efficient. You will use your strong communication skills to tell rich, meaningful stories using data and influence decisions. You will develop strong relationships across the organization, working collaboratively with clients, peers and key leaders to drive results for your team, the department and clients.

In this role, you will be a talent advisor to Google leaders and communicate insights about the outside talent market. You will work to develop search strategies and lead engagements to position Google for success.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum Salary of $168,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Retail Operations Manager
responsibilities:
• Develop and build relationships with key retail stakeholders to influence business and purchase experience in stores and online.
  • Manage a large team to drive retail business, including third-party vendor selection, onboarding, contracting, budgeting, and performance management.
  • Create, implement, and operationalize new field programs and field execution standards across training, merchandising, assisted selling, mystery shopping, customer experience, and product launches.
  • Own business goals and budgets jointly with account teams, and understand key levers that influence goals, investments and return on investments, and retailer/carrier engagement.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and drive the Chromebook purchase experience through fixtures, shelf compliance, training, and representative recommendations to achieve brand goals.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in retail regional field sales in consumer electronics.
  • 5 years of experience in vendor management, including contract negotiations, sourcing, and vendor performance management.
  • Experience managing cross-functional teams, and profit and loss (P&L) for retail.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Business Administration (MBA).
  • Experience in store operations, channel management, new product introduction (NPI), and product management with progressively increasing responsibility.
  • Experience in retail business strategy, or financial planning and execution, with a problem-solving, detail-oriented mindset.
  • Ability to work in a consultative manner, influencing internal and external retailer/carrier partners.
  • Ability to communicate and influence effectively by presenting data in a compelling way.

description:
As Retail Operations Manager, you will be responsible for maximizing business through key retail channels (e.g., stores, call centers, online, etc.) and optimizing the last mile purchase experience for Google’s Chromebook portfolio.

In this role, you will lead multiple teams to design and deliver channel business programs including compliance, training, incentives, merchandise, and sales. You will work with Marketing, Product, and Account teams to optimize the purchase experience (e.g. demos, navigation) and manage relationships with field and corporate retailer personnel responsible for business activities.

title: SAP Application Engineer, Devices and Services
responsibilities:
• Design, architect, and own projects, strategies, problems, and solutions, build technical roadmaps for teams, and lead cross-organizational collaboration.
  • Integrate disparate projects to create reusable components in the SAP systems, partner with teams to define and implement solutions that enhance business processes, and integrate third-party products into a SAP ERP system.
  • Identify and analyze situations and data to solve business challenges.
  • Develop, build, and deploy applications using SAP development methodologies, platforms, and technologies and work with analysts to translate business needs into technical solutions.
  • Maintain development practices (e.g., technical design, solution development, systems configuration, writing code, etc.) and provide direction for architecture, design, build, and support activities required for SAP and other enterprise software platforms.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in coding, designing, and developing SAP technical solutions.
  • Experience with advanced business application programming (ABAP) and SAP development methodologies (e.g., Fiori, Core Data Services, etc.).
  • Experience with CI/CD based development using abapGit or similar tools.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with development tools (e.g., JavaScript, TypeScript, etc.).
  • Experience in full system implementation lifecycles (e.g., analyze, design, build, test, implement, support, etc.).
  • Experience implementing supply chain or financial solutions using SAP technologies (e.g., SAP MM/SD/PP, PO, CPI, or Ariba) and on-premise/cloud implementations of SAP.
  • Experience implementing and customizing third-party software or building custom supply chain/financial applications.
  • Knowledge of information management, data modeling, system integration, development methodologies, and unit testing.

description:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.

With your technical expertise, you build business applications and influence the design of features that improve the reliability of our applications and systems. You also define the scope of technical projects and oversee execution.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Salary range of $130,000 - $139,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Sales Engineer, Financial Services, Digital Assets, Google Cloud
responsibilities:

  • Oversee technical aspects of solutions including: solution briefings, proof of concept work, and coordination of supporting technical resources.
  • Make solutions-based recommendations on integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms, and application infrastructure required to implement a complete solution tailored to the account or industry.
  • Build demos on advanced capabilities of Google Cloud Platform (GCP) driving towards a customer-centric solution on Blockchain, Distributed Ledger Technology, Digital Assets, Crypto, and Exchanges ecosystem.
  • Work with customers/partners to demonstrate and prototype Google Cloud product integrations in customer/partner environments enabling Blockchain, Distributed Ledger Technology, Digital Assets, Crypto, and Exchanges technologies.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 5 years of experience as a technical sales engineer in a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role.
  • Experience with Blockchain, Digital Assets, and Crypto companies.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 5 years of experience with Blockchain, Digital Assets, and Crypto technologies.
  • FinTech or Financial Services Sector experience.
  • Experience applying blockchain/distributed ledger technology to enterprise use cases.
  • Experience in advanced security (e.g., Cryptography, Authentication Protocols, Identity and Access Management etc.).
  • Experience with developing data warehousing, data lakes, batch or real-time event processing, and ETL workflows solutions including architecture design, implementing, tuning, schema design, and query optimization of scalable and distributed systems.
  • Direct skills to be able to create a quick demo/prototype of the customer use case/solution.

description:
The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Sales Engineer, you will work with the Sales team to position Google Cloud with our strategic blockchain and distributed ledger-based customers, and enable our traditional enterprise customers looking to embrace blockchain technologies while leveraging Google’s ecosystem of blockchain-native partners. You'll help customers understand the power of Google Cloud, develop creative cloud solutions and architectures to solve their business challenges, and problem-solve any potential technical roadblocks. You will actively identify new customer opportunities and engage customers to help them to understand Google Cloud’s value proposition. Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities, and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

  • 5 years of experience as a technical sales engineer in a cloud computing environment or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role.
  • Experience with Blockchain, Digital Assets, and Crypto companies.

title: Sales Engineer, Infrastructure Modernization, Financial Services, Google Cloud
responsibilities:
• Meet with customers and participate directly in key agreements and accounts. Prepare and deliver product messaging to highlight the Google Cloud value proposition specific to the market or customer.
  • Oversee technical aspects of solutions including: solution briefings, proof of concept work, and coordination of supporting technical resources.
  • Make solutions-based recommendations on integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms, and application infrastructure required to implement a complete solution tailored to the account or industry.
  • Lead detailed strategy in generating industry-specific business growth opportunities for Google Cloud.
  • Manage multiple opportunities through the entire cycle simultaneously, working with cross-functional teams as necessary, and serve as a customer-vertical contact for adoption-related activities.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in virtualization or cloud native architectures in a customer-facing or support role.
  • Experience with workload migrations, analyzing factors such as scalability, disaster recovery, and high availability.
  • Experience in performing technical presentations or public speaking.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA, Master's degree, or other advanced degree.
  • Experience in SEC, FINRA, CFTC, ISO 27001, Financial Services, Banking, Compliance, Infrastructure, Modernization, Phishing and Ransomware, and financial auditing.
  • Experience with Relational Databases, NoSQL Databases, and/or Big Data technologies and containers.
  • Experience with legacy and modern application development, cloud service delivery, and deployment.
  • Experience with application development technologies, architecting and developing software or infrastructure for scalable and secure distributed systems.
  • Advanced understanding of IaaS, PaaS, FaaS (XaaS).

Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. title: Security Engineer, Cloud Enterprise Infrastructure Protection
responsibilities:
• Design infrastructure and drive its implementation to protect Google networks and systems.
  • Provide security expertise and guidance to a diverse set of Google engineering and business teams.
  • Conduct security reviews of core corporate and production infrastructure.
  • Drive enterprise-focused security improvements to Google products and services.
  • Build security tools and processes using Python or Go for critical infrastructure protection, monitoring, and remediation.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience
  • 5 years of relevant experience in security.
  • Experience with attacks and mitigation methods and two or more in the following: operating system internals and hardening, security network design and protocols, and security assessments.
  • Experience coding in one general purpose languages.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
  • Experience in developing security tools, automation, or frameworks.
  • Knowledge of techniques, standards, and state-of-the-art capabilities for authentication, authorization, and use of cryptographic systems.

description:
There's no such thing as a "safe system" - only safer systems. Our Security team works to create and maintain the safest operating environment for Google's users and developers. As a Security Engineer, you help protect network boundaries, keep computer systems and network devices hardened against attacks and provide security services to protect highly sensitive data like passwords and customer information. Security Engineers work hands-on with network equipment and actively monitor our systems for attacks and intrusions. You also work with software engineers to proactively identify and fix security flaws and vulnerabilities.

You use your industry experience to own and drive the resolution of complex security incidents, policy questions and technical security issues.

The Enterprise Infrastructure Protection (EIP) Security team is a global engineering team, helping Googlers design, build, and use cloud infrastructure securely at scale. Security Engineers work on a broad set of efforts focusing on scaling and automating security infrastructure and processes. We contribute to open-source security software, conduct applied research, and implement novel technologies and architecture to deal with enterprise security across a diversity of computing platforms. Within Enterprise Infrastructure Protection, our EIP-Cloud team focuses on the security challenges unique to building on top of cloud computing.

Examples include establishing and enforcing perimeters to protect all of Google’s environments, defending a diverse set of clients, authentication, access, servers, and cloud services as well as influencing policy to simplify user experience and keep Google safe.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Salary range of $142,000 - $153,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
There's no such thing as a "safe system" - only safer systems. Our Security team works to create and maintain the safest operating environment for Google's users and developers. As a Security Engineer, you help protect network boundaries, keep computer systems and network devices hardened against attacks and provide security services to protect highly sensitive data like passwords and customer information. Security Engineers work hands-on with network equipment and actively monitor our systems for attacks and intrusions. You also work with software engineers to proactively identify and fix security flaws and vulnerabilities.

You use your industry experience to own and drive the resolution of complex security incidents, policy questions and technical security issues.

The Infrastructure Protection Security team is a global engineering team which helps Googlers design, build, and use infrastructure securely at scale. Security Engineers work on a broad set of efforts focusing on scaling and automating security infrastructure and processes. We contribute to open source security software, conduct applied research, and implement novel technologies and architecture to deal with enterprise security across a diversity of computing platforms such as mobile and cloud.

Examples include establishing and enforcing perimeters to protect all of Google’s environments, defending a diverse set of clients and servers in hostile environments, from common operating systems to emerging software and hardware platforms, and evolving authentication, access infrastructure, and policy to simplify user experience and keep Google safe.

At Google, our users come first, and the Systems Infrastructure team is at the heart of that promise. We build the technologies that transform the way we think about doing business. Whether working on our cloud systems, researching the latest in computer technology or keeping Google's internal systems humming, Googlers and users alike rely on us to keep things running. We're back-end experts: protecting your privacy and ensuring your security.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) $120,000 + bonus + equity + benefits
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Security Engineer, Security Response Incident Manager
responsibilities:
• Coordinate and drive resolution on a diverse range of incidents.
  • Analyze causes to identify trends and systematic issues.Improve information security (and privacy) of Google’s products and services.
  • Develop excellence in Incident Management through tools and infrastructure and preparing teams across Google through exercises and training.
  • Manage relationships across the company, legal, engineering, communications, and more.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of experience with an incident or emergency response coordination.
  • Experience in technical systems administration, software engineering, digital forensics, security engineering, or privacy engineering.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in computer science.
  • Experience with Python, Go, C/C++, and/or Java.
  • Understanding of legal, information security, and privacy frameworks, and safe harbor frameworks.
  • Ability to lead teams of people in ambiguous situations through influence and not authority.
  • Exceptional communication skills and ability to take a data-driven analytical approach toward solving complex challenges.
  • Outstanding organizational, prioritization and multitasking skills.

description:
There's no such thing as a "safe system" - only safer systems. Our Security team works to create and maintain the safest operating environment for Google's users and developers. As a Security Engineer, you help protect network boundaries, keep computer systems and network devices hardened against attacks and provide security services to protect highly sensitive data like passwords and customer information. Security Engineers work directly with network equipment and actively monitor our systems for attacks and intrusions. You also work with software engineers to proactively identify and fix security flaws and vulnerabilities.

You use your industry experience to own and drive the resolution of complex security incidents, policy questions and technical security issues.

In this role, you will use broad security experience and Digital Forensic and Incident Response (DFIR) knowledge to investigate and assess escalations, then use professional emergency management procedures to lead teams of Engineers, Lawyers, Executives, and others toward effective responses to any situation.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $142,000 - $153,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Security Sales Specialist, Google Cloud
responsibilities:
• Construct and execute an effective territory development plan. Advocate Security products in your territory to Security customers to meet or exceed quarterly goals.
  • Develop and drive pipeline, managing cycles, from lead generation to customer onboarding.
  • Build and maintain relationships to influence long-term strategic direction. Act as a trusted advisor to the account. 
  • Partner with Marketing, Customer Engineering, GCP, Customer Success, Channels, Product, and Engineering teams to understand the needs of the customer and provide excellent customer experience.
  • Represent Google Cloud Security in regional forecasts, all hands and team meetings. Serve as stakeholder to regional Google Cloud leads, reporting current, accurate, and timely forecasting and business performance.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of experience in a sales role in the enterprise software or cloud space.
  • 5 years of experience selling to clients in the enterprise cybersecurity or IT field.
  • Ability to travel up to 50%.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience carrying and exceeding strategic business goals in a sales role.
  • Experience starting a territory from the beginning, understanding the security partner ecosystem.
  • Knowledge of product and solution market trends in cybersecurity and cloud.
  • Ability to prioritize, plan, and organize sales activity with attention to detail.
  • Ability to build strong and continuous relationships with C-level executives across security/IT business units and ensure customer success and adoption, leading to customer expansion.
  • Excellent problem-solving, communication, presentation, and active listening skills.

description:
As a Security Sales Specialist, you will help us grow our cybersecurity business by building and expanding relationships with customers. You will work with customers to deliver true business value, demonstrate product functionality, and provide a comprehensive overview of key business use cases. You will lead day-to-day relationships with external customer stakeholders, leading with empathy, while identifying innovative ways to multiply your impact and the impact of the team as a whole. You will lead day-to-day relationships with customer stakeholders, leading with empathy, while identifying innovative ways to multiply your impact and the impact of the team as a whole. You will partner with internal Google Cloud Platform (GCP) sales teams to grow their security businesses and drive overall value for GCP.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $158,000 - $170,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

title: Senior Application Engineer, Security Solutions, Google Cloud
responsibilities:
• Own the security solution applications and be accountable for the entire software life-cycle and identify new areas of investment for the solutions/products.
  • Define a compelling goal and organize a cross-functional team to deliver around it, building processes for a team to enable execution.
  • Design, implement, and maintain tools for users of Google Cloud products.
  • Monitor and maintain production stack with focus on reliability and user engagement.
  • Focus on the entire web development stack including front-end, back-end, and databases.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 4 years of experience in full system implementation life-cycles (e.g., analyze, design, build, test, implement, support).
  • 4 years of experience implementing, customizing, and integrating third-party applications.
  • Experience with front-end (e.g., JavaScript, TypeScript, AngularJS), back-end (e.g., Java, Python) and Databases/Apps(e.g., SQL queries, Salesforce, Looker).

Preferred qualifications:

  • 2 years of experience leading Software Engineers.
  • Ability to interpret, manage, and connect customer data effectively, and communicate with technical teams at the right level.
  • Ability to communicate strategy and initiatives to executive internal stakeholders.
  • Ability to drive change in an organization and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

description:
At Google, we work at lightning speed. So when things get in the way of progress, the Business Systems Integration team steps in to remove those roadblocks. The team identifies time-consuming internal processes and then builds solutions that are reliable and scalable enough to work within the size and scope of the company. You listen to and translate Googler needs into high-level technical specifications, design and develop recommended systems and consult with Google executives to ensure smooth implementation. Whether battling large system processes or leveraging our homegrown suite of Google products for Googlers themselves, you help Googlers work faster and more efficiently.

With your technical expertise, you build business applications and influence the design of features that improve the reliability of our applications and systems. You also define the scope of technical projects and oversee execution.

As a Senior Application Engineer, you will write code and develop applications as well as drive a team of Application Engineers, to design and build applications, which drive adoption of security solutions. These applications include customer-facing risk assessments, compliance dashboards, maintaining existing customer-facing tools such as compliance reports manager, and orchestrating internal request systems in Salesforce.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Additional Information

(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $152,000 - $163,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Senior Engineering Manager, Augmented Reality App Platform
responsibilities:
• Lead and grow a team of software engineers responsible for one or more facets of our AR App Platform.
  • Review design documents and code written by other engineers and provide feedback.
  • Drive cross-functional efforts that involve teams across Google to solve problems.
  • Contribute to both technical documentation and team/process documentation.
  • Mentor and train team members on design techniques, coding standards, debugging systems, and engineering practices.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience with software development in a programming language (e.g., Python, C, C++, Java, JavaScript).
  • 5 years of experience in a technical leadership role overseeing projects.
  • 5 years of experience in a people management, supervision/team leadership role.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree or PhD in computer science or a related technical field.
  • 5 years of experience in mobile device application development.
  • 5 years of experience working in a matrixed organization.
  • Experience with building platform capabilities that enable other products, services, or businesses to exist.
  • Experience with shipping consumer electronics products.

description:
The Google Augmented Reality (AR) team’s mission is to give people the ability to make information instantly accessible. In this role, you will research, design, and develop new hardware and software technologies that make the computing experience more seamless.

As a Senior Engineering Manager on the AR App Platform team, you will lead a group of engineers on a journey to establish a software platform on which a thriving ecosystem of AR applications are built, distributed, and enjoyed across multiple form factors and hardware generations. You will contribute directly to product and technical strategy, and will guide, grow, and develop the team to successfully execute on that strategy in the context of the ambitions for AR.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.

(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $245,000 - $263,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Senior Outbound Product Manager, Privacy and Policy Infrastructure
responsibilities:
• Create the market for pToolkit by working on demos, presentation, blogs, reference architecture, analyst relations, and competitive positioning. 
  • Define and refine the approach for the pToolkit suite to be adopted by our customers, as well as the go-to-market strategy.
  • Create materials to aid adoption.
  • Define a tiring strategy and the levels for privacy, security, and other compliance aspects. Define and refine metrics and measurement techniques for success.
  • Work with partner teams in the Google Cloud Platform to create repeatable and scalable content, process, and structures.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience with infrastructure products, big systems, developer experiences, tool chains, or frameworks.
  • Experience building consensus, defining product strategy, goal, and go-to-market strategies in an environment with many stakeholders.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with messaging, field enablement, sales programs, and whole story analyst relations.
  • Experience creating competitive assessments.
  • Experience collaborating with multiple teams and influencing technical stakeholders.
  • Experience in regulatory framework affecting the tech industry, such as international laws governing privacy, antitrust, competition issues, etc.

description:
Google's Outbound Product Managers are the highly technical product portfolio leaders internally to infrastructure partners, our teams, and with customers. Our team drives customer discovery activities, gathers requirements, and manages the feedback loop with customers, partners, and customer success teams. In this role, you will need to determine the right customer approach to engage all of Google’s Product Areas.

The Core team builds the technical foundation behind Google’s flagship products. We are owners and advocates for the underlying design elements, developer platforms, product components, and infrastructure at Google. These are the essential building blocks for excellent, safe, and coherent experiences for our users and drive the pace of innovation for every developer. We look across Google’s products to build central solutions, break down technical barriers and strengthen existing systems. As the Core team, we have a mandate and a unique opportunity to impact important technical decisions across the company.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum Salary of $174,000 - $187,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

description:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
