description:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

As one of the core members of the Business Messages Engineering team, you will be responsible for building a robust Business Messages experience with a path to sustainable business generation for Google. You will be responsible for building a scalable product and driving many key features where users and businesses can communicate efficiently over chat and conduct customer support and commerce, while also partnering closely with teams across Google including Maps, Ads, Commerce, and Pay.

Business Communications team is proud to share a rich set of values and cultivates an inclusive culture.

The Communications team is tasked with improving the way people and businesses around the world communicate with one another. The next generation of mobile users will communicate in ways that differ from today's environment, and we’ll define Google's approach to this vision in two broad categories.

Communications - we’re building a suite of communications products distributed through close carrier and OEM partnerships developed across the world, and Rich Communication Services, a technology aimed at dramatically upgrading SMS to include more dynamic communications features.

Connectivity - we’re responsible for Google Fi, the innovative, disruptive wireless service, iterating on the first phone-based eSIM, and several platform and B2B carrier technologies.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $168,000 - $181,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Google Cloud's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google Cloud's needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. You will anticipate our customer needs and be empowered to act like an owner, take action and innovate. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to find the perfect blend of software design practices and the modeling, and performance analysis works that informs the system architecture and design of Google systems.

You will use your software engineering expertise to help solve complex problems including but not limited to hardware acceleration, performance roadblocks, system hierarchies, concurrency, computer organization, and whole-stack co-design and optimizations. Whether your strength is in software systems, with a good understanding of hardware, or you are a hardware engineer with software proficiency, this balanced role will let you shine in both disciplines at the same time.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $198,000 - $212,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

The Human Interface Device Software team for Biometrics builds amazing features and Google software experiences on Pixel devices powered by Google’s in-house Tensor chipset. Our team delivers high-quality sensing features for Pixel users. Our goal is to deliver the world's best mobile experience to our Pixel users, every year.

In this role, you’ll be working on the under display fingerprint sensors that are critical for providing secure authentication experience to our end-users. You will be part of a fast-moving team, and work on mission critical projects for Pixel and Google.

The Google Pixel team focuses on designing and delivering the world's most helpful mobile experience. The team works on shaping the future of Pixel devices and services through some of the most advanced designs, techniques, products, and experiences in consumer electronics. This includes bringing together the best of Google’s artificial intelligence, software, and hardware to build global smartphones and create transformative experiences for users across the world.

In this role, you would be responsible for leading and driving some of the central workstreams that are critical to the success of Google Workspace sovereignty efforts. You will oversee the infrastructure we’re building to support teams across Google Workspace. Our products need to manage information at a massive scale, and you’ll have the opportunity to have an impact on critical business objectives that span across the broader organization.

Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

description:
Google Cloud’s Collaboration and Communication (C&C) team builds online tools to help consumers and businesses communicate and collaborate more effectively. You get email, video meetings, documents, and more – and access to them from anywhere, anytime, on any device.

Working in this role, you could end up on one of our many exciting teams including: Google Workspace products: Video (Google Meet), Chat, Core Platforms, Security and Compliance, Client Infrastructure for Workspace, Distributed Systems for Workspace.

Google Vault is a premium application that is part of Google Workspace. Vault enables customer data retention and eDiscovery across Google Workspace services such as Gmail, Docs, Drive, Groups, and Chat. As part of the team, you will have the opportunity to work on customer user journeys at Google scale.

As a Staff Software Engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to the Google Workspace enterprise roadmap. You will work with cross-functional team members and stakeholders to decide on the vision and scope of your product area. You'll leverage your technical expertise to manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables of delightful customer experiences. You will be involved in the entire software development lifecycle from requirements and design to testing, deployment, and production support. You'll be a leader who is enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward for Workspace and Google Cloud.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

title: Staff Software Engineer, Infrastructure
responsibilities:

description:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

Google aspires to be an organization that reflects the globally diverse audience that our products and technology serve. We believe that in addition to hiring the best talent, a diversity of perspectives, ideas and cultures leads to the creation of better products and services.

Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

title: Staff Software Engineer, Infrastructure, Linux Kernel
responsibilities:
• Design, develop, test, and deploy software at scale based on Linux Kernel/Open Source technologies by leveraging the Linux community to meet our ever growing infrastructure requirements.
  • Design, guide, and vet systems designs within the scope of the broader area, and write product or system development code to solve ambiguous problems.
  • Engage and lead existing Linux Kernel projects across many teams in Google Compute Infrastructure.
  • Define new projects, solutions, architectures, and kernel roadmap in key subsystems such as Memory.
  • Monitor industrial, academic, and Linux Kernel Open Source trends in computing and determine the intersection in our product roadmaps.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in software development, and with data structures/algorithms.
  • 5 years of experience testing and launching software products, and 3 years of experience with software design and architecture.
  • Experience with C, Linux Kernel, and Operating Systems.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master’s degree or PhD in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field.
  • 5 years of experience building and developing large-scale infrastructure, distributed systems or networks, and/or experience with compute technologies, storage, and/or hardware architecture.
  • 3 years of experience in a technical leadership role leading project teams and setting technical direction.
  • 3 years of experience working in a complex, matrixed organization involving cross-functional, and/or cross-business projects.
  • Experience with virtual machines, hypervisors, KVM (kernel based virtual machine).
  • Experience in contributing to the Linux kernel development community.

description:
Google Cloud's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google Cloud's needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. You will anticipate our customer needs and be empowered to act like an owner, take action and innovate. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

As part of the Google Compute Infrastructure team, you will contribute in a Staff Software Engineer role in the memory management subsystem of Linux Kernel. You will be responsible for co-authoring the kernel roadmap, driving consensus on architectural discussions, and designs across teams inside and outside compute infrastructure (all the way to upstream kernel.org). You will be defining, owning, driving, and contributing to kernel projects.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Additional Information

description:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

Persistent Disk provides mission-critical block storage solutions to tens of thousands of enterprises affecting millions of users, and manages exabytes of data. It is a vital component of Google Cloud: every Google Compute Engine Virtual Machine relies on disks provided by Persistent Disk.

Meeting customer needs in this space is an interesting and technically difficult challenge, because building a scalable distributed system with performance characteristics comparable to locally attached disks (100,000s IOPS, microsecond latency with low variation) is hard!

In this role, you'll help us define the technical vision and set direction for 7-10 engineers working in these areas. You'll also mentor team members and drive prioritization, planning, and execution of multi-year projects.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $198,000 - $212,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

The Pixel Camera Software team delivers the Pixel Camera, from silicon support and drivers up through system software, algorithms, 3A, and image quality, to the app experience, and features.

The Google Pixel team focuses on designing and delivering the world's most helpful mobile experience. The team works on shaping the future of Pixel devices and services through some of the most advanced designs, techniques, products, and experiences in consumer electronics. This includes bringing together the best of Google’s artificial intelligence, software, and hardware to build global smartphones and create transformative experiences for users across the world.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $168,000 - $181,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Staff Software Engineer, Responsible AI, Google Research
responsibilities:
• Lead collaboration with business areas, to identify problems in the broader Responsible AI space, and to align project plans for measuring and remediate Responsible AI problems.
  • Design, guide, and vet systems designs relevant to Responsible AI, contribute to novel machine learning research when the solution is not yet known, and write product or system development code to ensure the solution is effective in real production systems.
  • Mentor and train other team members on system design, machine learning modeling, and coding techniques relevant to the Responsible AI space.
  • Partner with Research Scientists to foster research that can be impactful in products and to bring state-of-the-art research to bear in product engagements.
qualifications:

  • 3 years of experience in a technical leadership role leading project teams and setting technical direction.
  • 3 years of experience working in a complex, matrixed organization involving cross-functional, and/or cross-business projects.

description:
Software engineers in Google Research develop the next-generation technologies that could change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information in Google products.

In the Responsible AI space, there is a tremendous opportunity for research and product impact at the intersection of Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning Robustness, motivated by real world research challenges, such as how can a ML-based conversational agent knows “surgeons” are relevant to “operation knifes” but not to a particular gender, because the gender correlation for “surgeons” is likely spurious?

As a Staff Software Engineer you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables, while ensuring algorithmic and engineering quality appropriate for Google-scale product applications.

Our team mission is making Google’s products more inclusive and responsible with machine learning research and engagements.

As a team, we conduct foundational research on measurement and modeling approaches that can improve responsibility-relevant properties such as fairness, diversity and robustness. We research engagements to identify and verify research learnings in Google product contexts, and we conduct strategic engagements to drive inclusion and responsibility impact for end users in high-impact Product Areas.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $198,000 - $212,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

Chrome Browser has more than three billion active users, and one of our largest growth opportunities lies in enterprise environments. Businesses bring a unique set of needs and challenges for software deployed in their environments. Our team understands those needs and builds technology to help organizations succeed. The Chrome Enterprise team focuses on developing features that solve issues for companies and organizations who deploy and manage Chrome on fleets of devices (e.g., desktop and mobile).

With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.

Google is an engineering company at heart. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on users around the world. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, social to local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

description:
Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

TensorFlow Federated (TFF) is an open-source framework for machine learning and other computations on decentralized data. TFF provides a framework for defining general federated computations, higher-level libraries for aggregation, learning, other tasks, as well as a runtime for executing federated computations in a data center environment.

description:
The Open Codecs team at Google advances the media compression technology for Google and the industry. Our mission is to make the best compression technology universally available, enabling the efficient delivery of video, image, audio, and cross-reality over the internet. Experts on the team have been the driving power behind open source projects (e.g., VP9, AV1, AV2, WebP, AVIF, Lyra, and Draco). The team is deeply proud that the technology developed by the team has helped billions of people around the world connect, work, study, and live.

People watch and produce hours of media content every day. Compression technology is at the heart to enable the delivery of rich media experiences over the internet. As a Staff Software Engineer, Video Codec Specialist, you will develop algorithms that go into the next-generation international standard. Your innovations will help drive the entire industry forward and make media experiences better for billions of users around the world every day.

At its heart, Google is a research company advancing research across a broad range of topics, addressing key scientific or engineering questions or developing fundamentally new capabilities. The advances will result in product and service innovations helpful for users around the world and change how users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum Salary of $198,00 - $212,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

responsibilities:

  • Mentor and lead stakeholders and researchers to generate hypotheses and develop plans for high-quality, high-impact research.
qualifications:

Preferred qualifications:

  • PhD in a related field.
  • 8 years of experience working in user experience, research, or similar role.
  • Experience in a variety of product spaces, applied research and/or academic settings.
  • Experience in communicating user research findings with cross-functional partners, executive stakeholders, and executives to drive impact.
  • Understanding of the strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during the product development process.

description:
At Google, User Experience Researchers (UXRs) help everyone focus on the user. In this role, you will create understanding and empathy around user needs, stated and unstated, for your entire product team including designers, product managers, and engineers. You will do so by conducting primary research, exploring the behaviors and motivations of our users through methods like field visits, ethnography, surveys, usability testing, and logs analysis. Your research will help us create useful, usable, and delightful new products and features for people as well as continually innovating on our existing products. You’ll inspire change at all stages of product development by delivering compelling, written, in-person and visual presentations on your findings.

The UXR community at Google is unique. As part of our group, you will have the chance to work not only with the other UXRs on your immediate team but to work and learn from UXRs across the company through regular in-person meetups, established mentorship programs, access to our internal research tools, and 20% projects. Google is a place where UXRs can do their best work.

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $180,000 - $194,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. .

description:
As a Strategic Google Cloud Consultant focused on Chronicle Security, you'll provide technical guidance to customers adopting Chronicle for their security monitoring and operational needs. You will provide best practices on using Chronicle for security operations, threat hunting, incident response, setting up cloud native architectures, and more.

You'll provide prescriptive guidance in ensuring customers receive the best of what Google Cloud Security can offer and ensure that customers have the best experience in migrating, building, and modernizing their security monitoring and operations using Chronicle Security Platform. Additionally, you will work closely with Product Management and Product Engineering to drive excellence in Google Cloud Security products and features.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $139,000 - $150,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
The Android Enterprise team is committed to make Android a helpful platform for work. We build products, services, and capabilities that enable digital transformation for a set of industries. With focus on security, manageability, application distribution, and productivity, we help companies transform their businesses and help employees be more productive.

You will work with strategic technology partners, including application developers, that represent the technical foundation for Android's enterprise customers. You will work with strategic customers to help them leverage Android in their digital transformation goals. You will closely collaborate with Program Managers, Engineering, Global Partnerships, Developer Relations, and Partner Engineering to represent enterprise developers.

You will help enterprises best leverage Android by ensuring the tools they rely on deliver the best experience. In this role, you will advance Android’s business goals and strategic agendas, and help partners prioritize their development of Android experiences. You will ensure that the combination of Android and our partners’ solutions operate better for our mutual customers, for our partners, and for Google.

Google’s Global Partnerships team powers extraordinary user experiences through partnerships that solve users’ needs, advance our partners’ goals, and further Google’s mission. Our team provides meaningful solutions — from helping publishers and developers grow their businesses through monetization solutions, to helping our long-term partners anticipate and navigate change in a way that delivers economic and reputational value. We build and distribute products through partnerships across a multitude of product areas, including Ads, Search & Assistant, Geo, Platforms & Ecosystems, Devices & Services, Health, Retail, Payments, Next Billion Users, and more. We collaborate across Google, ensuring a coordinated approach when engaging with our most complex and strategic partners.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $107,000 - $115,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

responsibilities:

title: Strategic Planning Lead, People Operations
responsibilities:
• Build and lead People Operations agile business planning capability inclusive of a year-round People Operations clearinghouse process to prioritize investments and align resources as business dynamics shift.
  • Enable Google’s People Strategy and People Operations’ HR Excellence strategy by designing and leading the annual planning process to analyze opportunity areas, inform decision-making, and articulate progress and goals in the overall business plan.

description:
The Strategy and Innovation team (S&I) shapes Google’s People Strategy, ensuring the entire function is delivering value and excellence. As part of the S&I organization, the People Operations Planning team guides and enables People Operations’ long-term people and HR Excellence strategy, incubating long range opportunities, leading annual business and resource planning, and managing Objectives and Key Results and People Plan operations.

In this role, you will be partnering with a group of stakeholders, working in a fast-paced and ambiguous environment. You will help build an agile strategic planning capability for People Operations, incorporating agile principles into business planning, data-driven decision-making and priority setting, as well as resource alignment.

You will architect and lead the organization’s annual business plan, collaborating closely with leaders across People Operations functions and the Chief People Officer, and establishing the governance, process, and funding strategy for the upcoming year in alignment with the organization’s overall HR Excellence strategy. You will also lead the build out of short cycle planning through a People Operations clearinghouse process in coordination with the People Operations Leadership Team. This role affords a unique perspective and influence on Google’s people priorities and People Operations’ annual and long-term strategies.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $213,000 - $229,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

  • Manage team-wide and executive communications. Develop and manage content for off-sites and executive presentations. Run on-boarding and training programs while identifying problems and issues across organizations and create programs/processes to solve them.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in strategy, operations, or procurement.
  • Experience in stakeholder management.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Understanding of business applications.
  • Ability to work in ambiguity and with a global team.
  • Ability to take initiative in a collaborative environment.
  • Ability to create effective relationships, influence, and collaborate at all organizational levels and with various cross-functional partners across businesses.
  • Ability to communicate at all levels of the organization, including executive stakeholders.
  • Excellent problem-solving, strategic, analytical, and communication skills, and business acumen.

description:
The Business Partnership team is a core part of Google’s Global Procurement Organization (GPO). The Business Partnership team is designed to support, influence, and contribute to the overall strategic direction and operational performance of the organization.

In this role, you will directly report to and support the Head of Business Partnerships and Regional Procurement to help effectively run the organization. You will work across strategic and operational efforts, including leading and contributing to the vision and strategy creation process and narrative development, ensuring effective communication, alignment, and execution of the organization’s strategy and roadmap within the organization and throughout GPO, running special projects and strategic organization efforts, and helping to run the business cadence.

You will partner with leadership in Business Partnerships, reports, and cross-functional partners to develop and communicate strategy and decision-making with the organization. You will also partner closely with key cross-functional partners to align strategies and business decisions.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) (Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $203,000 - $218,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. *Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Strategy and Operations Manager, Collaboration and Communication
responsibilities:
• Establish and optimize operating processes to effectively manage the organization by partnering closely across multiple functions simultaneously. Use cross-functional knowledge to understand issues, trends, and perspectives that may influence partners and work.
  • Manage annual strategic/business planning processes in coordination with your team and key partners. Facilitate communication and decision-making with leaders and teams within Google Cloud and across Google.
  • Partner with Finance, People Operations, Communications, Product Leads, and other cross-functional stakeholders to effectively allocate and manage headcount and related costs to ensure people/project reporting is maintained.
  • Lead and support critical projects based on emergent business needs. Structure and execute analyses required to develop recommendations and communicate findings to the leadership team and the organization.
  • Enable organization wide execution of initiatives and manage leadership expectations.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in Operations, Strategy, or Product Operations roles, building relationships and leading operational initiatives.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in stakeholder management.
  • Experience in Strategic or Annual Planning for large organizations.
  • Experience in management or operations consulting and managing/interpreting various stakeholder and team member expectations.
  • Ability to create effective relationships, influence, and collaborate at all organizational levels and with various cross-functional partners (e.g., Google Cloud, Finance, HR) without direct authority.
  • Ability to work in ambiguity and manage changing priorities.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication, problem-solving, strategic, and analytical skills and excellent business acumen.

title: Student Researcher, BS, 2022
responsibilities: • Participate in cutting-edge research to develop solutions for real-world, large-scale problems.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Linguistics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, Natural Sciences, or a related technical field.
  • Experience in one area of computer science (e.g., Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Quantum Information Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, or similar).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Currently attending a degree program in the U.S.
  • Currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after completion of the internship.
  • Experience as a researcher, including internships, full-time, or at a lab.
  • Experience contributing research communities or efforts, including publishing papers in major conferences or journals.
  • Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages (e.g., C/C++, Java, MATLAB, Go, Python, or similar).
  • Ability to speak and write in English fluently.

description:
The Student Researcher Program’s primary objective is to foster academic collaborations with students through research at Google. Join us for a paid Student Researcher position that offers the opportunity to work directly with Google research scientists and engineers on cutting-edge research projects.

The Student Researcher Program offers more opportunities for research students to work on research projects at Google in a less structured way. The program allows for flexibility beyond the limitations of our traditional internship program on aspects such as duration, time commitment, and working location (with options for on-site or remote). The topics student researchers work on tend to be open-ended and exploratory, and don't always have a clear deliverable like a traditional internship would.

Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, we’re working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software engineers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world's fast-paced business needs.
application_instruction:
Participation in this program requires that you are located in the United States for the duration of the engagement.

NOTE: This opportunity is intended for students who are pursuing a BS degree with an anticipated graduation date after December 2023, depending on their program and unique circumstances. If you are graduating before December 2023, we encourage you to apply to the Research Internship opening.

To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English (PDFs preferred). Please ensure your anticipated graduation dates (in MM/YY) and any proficiency in coding languages are listed on resume

description:
The Student Researcher Program’s primary objective is to foster academic collaborations with students through research at Google. Join us for a paid Student Researcher position that offers the opportunity to work directly with Google research scientists and engineers on cutting-edge research projects.

The Student Researcher Program offers more opportunities for research students to work on critical research projects at Google in a less structured way. The program allows for flexibility beyond the limitations of our traditional internship program on aspects such as duration, time commitment, and working location (with options for on-site or remote). The topics student researchers work on tend to be open-ended and exploratory, and don't always have a clear deliverable like a traditional internship would.

Google Research is building the next generation of intelligent systems for all Google products. To achieve this, we’re working on projects that utilize the latest computer science techniques developed by skilled software engineers and research scientists. Google Research teams collaborate closely with other teams across Google, maintaining the flexibility and versatility required to adapt new projects and foci that meet the demands of the world's fast-paced business needs.
application_instruction:
Participation in this program requires that you are located in the United States for the duration of the engagement.

NOTE: This opportunity is intended for students who are pursuing a PhD degree with an anticipated graduation date after December 2023, depending on their program and unique circumstances. If you are graduating before December 2023, we encourage you to apply to the Research Internship opening.

To start the application process, you will need an updated CV or resume and a current unofficial or official transcript in English (PDFs preferred). Please ensure your anticipated graduation dates (in MM/YY) and any proficiency in coding languages are listed on resume

title: Supplier Manager, Vendor Management Office, People Operations
responsibilities:
• Lead and manage the service delivery of multiple Human Resource operations to outsourced vendors. Be accountable for relationship, service, contract, and performance management of extended workforce service providers.
  • Work on projects that uplift People Operations Vendor Management Office’s capability, while providing innovation in extended workforce design and delivery.
  • Develop relationships, influence, and collaborate with cross-functional teams within People Operations and more broadly in Google. Collaborate with various internal groups to understand business requirements and implement processes.
  • Build networks in the industry, stay abreast with latest extended workforce models, and engage comfortably at an executive level with external vendor companies. Communicate initiatives with executive management and the organization.
  • Manage the overall relationship with the onsite vendor teams, guide quality and cost effective extended workforce plans.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in Vendor Operations Management and Extended Workforce Strategy
  • Experience managing projects/programs.
  • Experience in process design in Six Sigma, LEAN, Agile, etc.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 7 years of experience managing large-scale operations and/or working with/managing a team.
  • Experience managing change across different organizational functions/boundaries.
  • Experience finding solutions for and transitioning operations to third-party service providers.
  • Experience with extended workforce agreements and managing end-to-end operations and experience with business development for any third-party vendors.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with capability to process data to manage business strategies and decisions.

description:
As part of a fast growing team with a reputation for excellent customer service and delivering innovative solutions, you will assume ownership for the strategy, design, and execution of services delivered to People Operations through its network of global suppliers. As a Supplier Manager, you will conduct assessments of business operations and translate them into a scalable and delivery solution. You will be in charge of designing long-term delivery of services and you'll interact and build relationships with your key stakeholders within People Operations and other parts of Google such as Risk, Finance, Compliance, Audit, Procurement, etc.

*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $139,000 - $150,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

title: Systems Data Governance Program Manager, Contracting
responsibilities:
• Own various workstreams within Google’s procurement transformation program and support the development of strategic data sources of truth to enable systems and analytics.
  • Develop and coordinate the strategy, design, implementation, testing, deployment, and maintenance of procurement systems.
  • Liaise with the technical teams to drive the implementation of procurement technology solutions that significantly improve user experience while reducing risk.
  • Lead cross-functional teams to design system solutions to support the business requirements across Google, establish a strategy and gain buy-in from key stakeholders, engage in technical design and approval of key design decisions.
  • Identify cross-workstream dependencies to ensure a cohesive strategy. Identify potential risks and mitigation strategies of solutions.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 8 years of industry experience in data design and governance of systems and processes.
  • Experience working with engineering and data teams to build analytical capabilities.
  • Experience with systems implementation, integration, and data standardization.
  • Experience extracting data for reporting or analytical purposes.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working across teams on implementing and configuring third-party enterprise software solutions for agreement management or related procurement processes.
  • Experience extracting, transforming, and analyzing large datasets from various sources in order to inform strategies and guide key decisions.
  • Experience presenting to and working with technical and non-technical executive stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of data governance best practices for new system implementations.
  • Ability to communicate effectively, and manage/lead global projects.

title: Systems Engineer, Android TV OS
responsibilities:
• Innovate, design, implement, and test software features for TV embedded systems (streaming sticks, panel TVs and set top boxes). 
  • Build high-quality Android TV OS reference designs that provides the foundational hardware and software for TV OEMs to launch devices with quality at scale.
  • Bring up prototype Hardware systems, and work with TV devices to bring a high-performance Google TV experience to users.
  • Be an expert or acquire expertise in technologies that our SoC vendors contribute to the TV OS platform, particularly in the areas of kernel, bootloader, TEE, HAL implementations, and Android framework.
  • Advise and influence TV partners and vendors on solutions that benefit the TV ecosystem, and perform implementation reviews, advocate product features, and ensure the prompt and proper resolution of technical challenges.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in software engineering or development in Java, C/C++ in Android, or other Linux-based embedded systems.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience developing and troubleshooting audio, video and graphics software, and hardware systems with SoCs, OEMs and Original Device Manufacturer (ODMs) partners.
  • Experience working with customer or partner companies to launch products.
  • Ability to share technical knowledge and information with others.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

title: Systems Engineer, Site Reliability Engineering
responsibilities:
• Engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of services from inception and design, through deployment, operation, and refinement.
  • Support services before they go live through activities such as system design consulting, developing software platforms and frameworks, capacity planning, and launch reviews.
  • Maintain services once they are live by measuring and monitoring availability, latency, and overall system health.
  • Scale systems sustainably through mechanisms like automation, and evolve systems by pushing for changes that improve reliability and velocity.
  • Practice sustainable incident response and blameless postmortems.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience programming in one or more of the following: C, C++, Java, Python, or Go.
  • Experience with Unix/Linux operating systems internals (e.g., filesystems, system calls), and with networking (e.g., routing, ESDN) or cloud systems.
  • Experience with analyzing and troubleshooting systems.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience designing large-scale distributed systems.
  • Experience designing and developing software oriented towards systems or network automation.
  • Ability to debug, optimize code, and automate routine tasks.
  • Systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with effective communication skills and a sense of drive.

description:
Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) combines software and systems engineering to build and run large-scale, massively distributed, fault-tolerant systems. SRE ensures that Google's services—both our internally critical and our externally-visible systems—have reliability, uptime appropriate to users' needs and a fast rate of improvement. Additionally SRE’s will keep an ever-watchful eye on our systems capacity and performance. Much of our software development focuses on optimizing existing systems, building infrastructure and eliminating work through automation.

On the SRE team, you’ll have the opportunity to man age the complex challenges of scale which are unique to Google, while using your expertise in coding, algorithms, complexity analysis and large-scale system design.SRE's culture of diversity, intellectual curiosity, problem solving and openness is key to its success. Our organization brings together people with a wide variety of backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. We encourage them to collaborate, think big and take risks in a blame-free environment. We promote self-direction to work on meaningful projects, while we also strive to create an environment that provides the support and mentorship needed to learn and grow.

To learn more: check out our books on Site Reliability Engineering, watch a recorded Hangout on Air to meet some of our SREs, or read a career profile about why a Software Engineer chose to join SRE.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

description:
In the Google Procurement Organization (GPO), our aim is to unlock value for Google to reinvest in what matters most. We do this by bringing velocity, efficiency, and security to Google, while partnering deeply across Google to deliver solutions fit for purpose. As a centralized organization operating in a high complexity environment, you will be a representative to stakeholders and suppliers to ensure the best outcomes. Our organization fosters a culture of collaboration and innovation while providing opportunities for ongoing career growth and development.

As a Program Manager within the Procurement Center of Excellence team, you will be responsible for leading initiatives focused on transforming the company’s procurement systems. You will partner closely with product and business teams across Google to understand user needs, design solutions, and manage the implementation and deployment of exceptional procurement capabilities. Within this new and rapidly growing team, you will also play a key role in guiding the overarching procurement transformation strategy, roadmap, and success criteria.

In this role, you will be responsible for helping influence process designs and configure systems to transform an agreement capability to drive efficiency, improve velocity, ensure compliance, and enable insights.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $116,000 - $125,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

title: Talent Development Consultant
responsibilities:
• Manage an active portfolio of executive leader clients per year, with a focus on critical talent in Underrepresented Groups.
  • Serve as a trusted development consultant to clients by assessing needs, creating customized, impactful development journeys, and partnering with the broader system of talent to drive outcomes aligned to Google's global talent strategy and diversity, equity, and inclusion commitments.
  • Partner with internal and external stakeholders to conceptualize, co-create, and facilitate specific development experiences for individual leaders.
  • Provide insightful data to guide decision making and provide proactive, equitable solutions, including the identification of consistent development journey profiles for leaders facing similar challenges.
  • Have familiarity with a suite of assessment tools to support effective and inclusive development recommendations.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Leadership Development, Organizational Development, I/O Psychology, Talent Management, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 12 years of experience in strategy/leadership, Learning and Development, and/or a consulting/client-facing role.
  • 5 years of experience in Talent Development and Executive Development.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master’s Degree in Leadership Development, Organizational Development, I/O Psychology, Talent Management, or other relevant fields.
  • Experience influencing, coaching, and engaging with executive leaders from diverse functional and technical backgrounds, as well as from underrepresented groups.
  • Experience in customized development planning for leaders.
  • Experience solving problems, thriving in ambiguity and change, and achieving goals.
  • Ability to create internal and external partnerships to support ongoing innovation in talent development strategy.
  • Ability to synthesize data into meaningful insights, understand trends, and develop recommendations for action.

description:
As a Talent Development Consultant (TDC) you will work with Google leaders to identify and prioritize development objectives and create customized development journeys to accelerate their leadership capability.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

description:
Technical writers plan, create, and maintain educational content as an integral part of the engineering or user experience. The content is often in the form of documentation, but may also be UI text, sample code, videos, or other educational material. Regardless of the content medium, technical writers are distinguished by their abilities to explain complex topics in a way that’s useful to their audience.

As a Technical Editor, you will edit tutorials, conceptual material, and architectural diagrams for software developers and IT experts who want to use Google's Cloud Platform. You will provide guidance to a team of professional Technical Writers and subject-matter experts who are creating product documents, including giving input and direction on document types, content model, style, terminology, and site design.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum Salary of $132,000 - $142,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you’ll use your technical expertise to lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish. You’ll work with stakeholders to plan requirements, identify risks, manage project schedules, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. You're equally comfortable explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical tradeoffs in product development with engineers.

Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.

This Technical Program Manager (TPgM) role will provide an opportunity to lead technically complex projects, cross-Product Area initiatives and partnerships. In this role, you will be responsible for fostering collaboration between cross-functional teams across Google, specifically throughout the Google Fi program. As TPgM you will scale technical programs and processes covering all aspects of the product lifecycle including developing requirement documents, creating project plans, driving execution and more.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $147,000 - $158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Using your extensive technical and leadership expertise, you manage projects of various size and scope, identifying future opportunities, improving processes and driving the technical directions of your programs.

description:
A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you’ll use your technical expertise to lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish. You’ll work with stakeholders to plan requirements, identify risks, manage project schedules, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. You're equally comfortable explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical tradeoffs in product development with engineers.

Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.

The Google Cloud Capacity team is responsible for the compute, storage, and network capacity planning for Google Cloud Platform (GCP). We are a team of customer-first, efficient planners, responsive fleet managers, and analytical leads that enable Google Cloud growth and efficiency.

In this role, you will help enable Google Cloud growth and success by ensuring that network capacity is used in a timely and efficient manner to support Google Cloud products and customers.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Additional Information

(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $147,000 - $158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.

*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you’ll use your technical expertise to lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish. You’ll work with stakeholders to plan requirements, identify risks, manage project schedules, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. You're equally comfortable explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical tradeoffs in product development with engineers.

Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.

The Technical Operations team within Google Research is working to enable smooth and efficient work within the product area by building the right tools and systems for our researchers.

As a Technical Program Manager, you will lead and drive our analytics effort to turn data into actionable insights and enable more research breakthroughs. You will have unprecedented visibility into the cutting-edge of machine learning (ML), and an ability to influence the future of Google Research investments.

Google Research addresses challenges that define the technology of today and tomorrow. From conducting fundamental research to influencing product development, our research teams have the opportunity to impact technology used by billions of people every day.

Our teams aspire to make discoveries that impact everyone, and core to our approach is sharing our research and tools to fuel progress in the field -- we publish regularly in academic journals, release projects as open source, and apply research to Google products.

description:
A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Program Manager at Google, you’ll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish — working with stakeholders to plan requirements, manage project schedules, identify risks, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. Your projects will often span offices, time zones, and hemispheres. It's your job to coordinate the players and keep them up to date on progress and deadlines.

Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.

The Systems and Services Infrastructure (S²Infra) team delivers solutions for both Cloud and the rest of Google. Given the massive move to the cloud and transformational trends in hardware technologies, we are in the enviable position to define the future of compute, storage, and networking.

As a S²Infra Technical Program Manager, you will focus on creating and delivering systems learning and development curriculum to onboard high-potential computer science university graduates who possess an excellent generalist background and equip them with the domain knowledge that would jump start them to success in system infrastructure roles at Google.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range of $169,000 - $181,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. Whether you are making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you have an eye on the staffing needs of Google and the broader hiring landscape. You are focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for Google's long-term hiring needs, and work across a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams. You are both scrappy and resourceful, creative and driven -- and excited to share the magic of working at Google.

Our team enables Google Recruiting to identify, engage, and hire priority candidates. We leverage data, intel, and partnerships across the People Operations organization to drive immediate hiring impact aligned to business needs and to leadership priorities.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (known elsewhere as "Human Resources"). We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. You’ll play an essential role advancing a more diverse, accessible, equitable, and inclusive Google through our hiring, promotion, retention, and inclusion practices.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $116,000 - $125,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
As a Technical Solutions Consultant, you will work with the customer and swiftly problem-solve technical issues to show how our products can make businesses more productive, collaborative, and innovative.

Communication is at the center of users’ lives and is the most engaging service on smartphones every day. The Google Communications team owns mobile phone communication for Google products: Messages, Duo, Phone, and Contacts, and we are bringing our products and technologies to users across the globe.

Our team's mission is to solve for the "last mile" to bridge Google products and our partners to reach users. We do so by extending engineering to provide the functionality, quality, and scale of Google products and solutions to partners.

Our team provides the consolidated technical voice feedback and insight from our partners/industry, to inform Product and Engineering teams on what it takes to be successful. We also seek out new opportunities by becoming experts with our partners and their technology, processes, and business models.

From startups building their first app to billion-user consumer companies crunching big data, the Google Cloud Platform gives developers and businesses the most advanced data and analytics solution on the market, along with Google's secure, high performance infrastructure. Our team of technical account managers and software engineers work with partners across all functions to develop solutions that harness Google's planet-wide platform to solve the world's most challenging problems.

Additional Information
(Colorado only*) Minimum salary range between $122,000 - $131,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
*Note: Disclosure as required by sb19-085 (8-5-20) of the minimum salary compensation range for this role when being hired into our offices in Colorado.

description:
Technical writers communicate complex information clearly, concisely and accurately, and without relying on jargon. As a technical writer, your role involves tasks such as writing conceptual overviews and procedures, reading and writing example code, or updating help center queries and FAQs. Technical writers play a big part at Google. They are a key link between engineers, marketing associates, developer advocates, as well as all the external users and developers, tying together many vital but disparate parts of the Google ecosystem.

Using your extensive technical and leadership experience, you manage a team of writers, setting direction, giving feedback, collaborating internally and lending specific content expertise.

Technical Writing Managers help technical writers take complex information and communicate it clearly, concisely, and accurately. With a unique cross-functional perspective, our team of technical writers is the key link between our engineers, acting as our developer advocates and the external users and developers who comprise the Google ecosystem. As a member of the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Technical Writing team, you’ll have a chance to grow your career in a fast-moving product area.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

description:
The Chrome Desktop team deeply values openness, collaboration, and a dedication to real problem solving through craft. We are stewards of one of the world's most popular pieces of software, and believe in the open source mission of Chrome. Joining our team means living our values of being humble, putting people first, and recognizing that the people and relationships matter when it comes to building great software.

We are the Chrome Extension and Web Store team. We enable the Chrome Browser to stretch its capabilities to be a browser for everyone and create a platform for extension developers to be successful. Our platform and our store provide the largest catalog of extensions in the world and it continues to grow. We want to provide the best technical documentation to our ecosystem developers so that they can help our platform to remain the best in the industry.
